description: This place is very eclectic and we had such a great time. We have traveled all around the world and haven't experience the service or atmosphere that the wine bar provides. Go upstairs and enjoy yourself, grown and sexy style
author: Natashia G.

description: Upper level is nice and clean. If you have a date definitely bring them here. I've been to Bottom's Up on and off for over 7 years. Shirley, the owner invested in this bar and she owned several bars in the city. My friend and I was drinking at upper level last night. Shirley served us stacks and drinks. Shirley works hard for their customers who appreciate her. I would come back again.
author: T B.

description:
6 TVs,  bunch of seating area,  dj on the weekends with no cover ...Moderately priced drinks... 

Sarah, the bartender, is a sweetheart and provides great service ...
author: George B.

description: Nice place for a first date. Decent parking on the street with meters. Service is good.food selection is nice but not a lot of vegetarian options except fries.nice and clean place with attentive service.
author: Nilu S.

description: Not much to complain about when it comes to Bottom's Up. They have a live dj without a cover, plenty of space to hang out in a booth or at the bar, and a few food items. Drinks are also cheap, as this fine dive has been a neighborhood staple for years, and the bartenders work very quickly. With TVs all around, you could do much worse. I'm hoping they get their kitchen in check, though. Biggest downside to this place.
author: Danny C.

description: Chicken wings, fries, calamari, ON POINT. I was pleasantly surprised. Appropriate prices, drinks are well made. Service was good and both ladies there where friendly and personable. The bathroom was well kept, another surprise. Overall cool spot. Will visit again.
author: George G.

description:
First of all I did ask her if smoking was allowed outside and she said no and I was OK with that but she asked me for registration for my service animal and according to the American disabilities act which every establishment should know there is no such thing, I tried to show her the rules according to the ADA and she refused to look at them on my cell phone. I assured her that my animal was indeed a service dog but she kept asking for paperwork and if you know anything about the American disabilities act or service dogs there is no such thing as paperwork or registration for service dogs. Furthermore she was extremely rude about it, I could have accepted it if she would have been nice about it but she was not. I'm OK with it because I don't plan to set foot on your establishment again but I did file a complaint with the Department of Justice, it takes a while but you will receive a notice.

I would suggest that you train your employees on that least being kinder to older people And I find it very insulting that not only what she rude but even after I pointed out that I was a veteran with a service dog she still dismiss me in an extremely rude manner.

Read the americans disabilities act rules:

Q7. What questions can a covered entity's employees ask to determine if a dog is a service animal?

A. In situations where it is not obvious that the dog is a service animal, staff may ask only two specific questions: (1) is the dog a service animal required because of a disability? and (2) what work or task has the dog been trained to perform? Staff are not allowed to request any documentation for the dog, require that the dog demonstrate its task, or inquire about the nature of the person's disability.

Do you see where an establishment is not allowed to ask for any documentation? Your employee is clearly in violation of the ADA law. Be sure that I will not let this go so that you will never make another person go through what I went through with your employee, she humiliated me and treated me horribly.
author: Diana S.

description: Lordy lord... first and definitely last.. busiest day of the year and they were under staffed... smh!!! Got there a little before 6pm and kitchen was not up and running...i knew how it felt to be to under staffed so i was quite patient. They had 2 bartenders and 2 servers and a fully packed bar. We placed our order but it took forever... but that wasn't the issue. We got our nachos and then later our wings. I then placed an order of jasmine rice.... i shit u not that shit took one hr. One effing hr for one scoop of jasmine rice after asking the server over 5x or i probably would not of got it at all. So i decided bring my ass down the block and get me a burrito because after 2 hrs of waiting, i was starving. So i sure did bring my burrito in the bar and long and behold all of a sudden i finally get the attention n service, but it sure wasn't pleasant. She told me to no outside food. Ok i get it because it is policy but fu... give me my damn food i ordered 2hrs ago then i wouldn't have this problem. So the owner and i got into argument, i told her monkey ass that on the busiest day she should not be understaffed and that she is losing money. Then along came the bartender in the picture saying that i didn't wait that long for my items, the nerve of this bitch. This whole situation could of been all good if they would of told their patrons the eff is going on and how long it would take so my monkey ass wouldn't have ordered shit.. so no thank you to bottoms up because my bottom is up and out that place in a heart beat. Good luck to better staffing and maybe on the next big day, you guys will get it together!!!
author: Theresa M.

description: Great bar...... Canelo vs GGG fight ppv will be shown here September 16th.  Lots of TV's and a great Tap selection for beer.
author: Alberto C.

description:
This bar belongs in the marina or anywhere, but not Mission and Ocean Ave.  

Nice staff, large/open/clean space, and digitized jukebox.  They also have a wine bar upstairs! Interesting for mission and ocean ave. The Excelsior is slowly changing 

Great place. Check It out
author: Angelica C.

description:
Great bar, great upstairs (recently remodeled) where you can have a quieter drink and talk.

Downstairs is great for watching a game.  See me smoking on the corner by the bus stop!
author: David B.

description: best bar in the mission. !!! 5 stars! Look for Shirley and the Lovely Raquel. They pour great drinks... and great personalities!
author: Rio P.

description:
I'm one of the regulars for the past 10 years. This place just amazes me how well developed and accommodating it has been for the customers. The bartenders are a HUGE factor why I come here. They make sure everyone is pleased and satisfied with food and drinks in their hands. 

The new wine bar is a creation that caters to many crowds. I'm happy to be able to call this place a family and friends bar. I highly recommend trying this place if you have never been before.
author: Anson W.

description: My favorite place to hand out after work. Upstairs is even better for private events ot party!!!!
author: Lex Z.

description:
WARNING: stay away from this place. I moved to the excelsior a few months ago, and have been looking for a good bar to hang out in that has a young crowd but wow was this place a disaster.  One of the bartenders (an Asian girl) immediately asked if we had been "partying" beforehand and refused to give my friend a drink despite the fact that we had literally not had a drink prior to arriving there. The Asian girl needs to be fired. She is rude, condescending and terrible at customer service.  Look I get it, people complain about bars if they wait too long for a drink or are too drunk and have a bad experience; this was just literally the worse customer service I've ever had at a bar.   Not worth the money or your time. 

If you want a fun place to hang out in the excelsior, go to the Dark Horse Inn, broken record or Dr Lounge, but stay away from this place.  This place looks okay from the outside but it's the worst option in the excelsior.
author: Allan G.

description:
My go-to bar in the area - not the fanciest place around (pending remodeling and wine-bar coming soon), but if you're in the mood for drinks - I recommend Bottom's Up. 

It's always a good time at Bottom's Up... 

Affordable pitchers of beer, $5 shots during happy hour... 

I am intrigued to how the wine bar upstairs will turn out.
author: Sam K.

description:
I usually do not write negative reviews unless a place is awful. This place is not just awful but offensive..
I thought it might be a fun place to walk to near a friend's house. So I tried it a couple of times because I really wanted to give it a chance. They charge high prices for disappointing food.  The drinks are watered down & taste strange - way over priced!  And the final thing that made me give up was the owner seems to be quite biased and rude. (If you are  black or gay do not go here.) Some people seem to like her. But I found her to be a little crazy.  She picks fights with patrons, especially black ones.  She's even been seen chasing people down the street.  So I had to give only one star, because I actually wonder how they make any money.
We'll be going to Broken record or one of the other better bars in the neighborhood from now on.
author: C C.

description:
We went there one week ago for the first time wanting to check out places in the neighborhood. A young  lady with lots of tattoos served us and she was awesome!
We checked out reviews and they were not very nice especially about a particular bartender. Well I guess we knew who she  tonight as we walked in for the second time. Just from the greeting we knew she was the one with bad reviews. Got my drink wrong, I asked for a toll glass with additional soda water and she said she had to charge me double . No comment!! Worst service ever! We asked about the name of the other bartender that was great and unfortunately she refused to tell us her schedule. How disappointing, we thought we had found the perfect place close to home.
author: lucia f.

description: If you want to be taken advantage of and lose about $200, give this place your money tonight. They will not disappoint!
author: James R.

description:
Came here the Saturday before Halloween and it was lightweight popping. They played mainly hip hop music during the time I was there and there were a few people dancing on their little stage area. Service wasn't bad, however they're too quick in picking up the cups. There were a couple of times where there was still about half an inch of beer left in our cups and they swooped it. They have snacks, but it's waay overcharged. $3 for a small bag of shrimp chips?! Craaaazy!

The place itself is pretty dark and loud, basically a club like environment. Don't think there's a dress code so you want to go clubbing, but aren't wearing the right attire, head to bottoms up instead.
author: Renee Y.

description:
Bottoms up, bottoms up, up, every single cup
 
Got a couple bottles, but a couple ain't enough
 
Bottoms up, bottoms up, up, throw your hands up
 
Tell security we 'bout to tear this club up

With no live Dj on a weekday, you have a jukebox that charges $1 for 2 songs, a modern venue and a small setting. Not the best location, but close to home for others. Food is available from 6p-10p, flat screen tv's to watch the game. Pay a visit on a weekday its dead, come on a weekend its packed. I happened to come on a Thursday night to watch some football & have some cocktails-status: dead LOL but thats okay because I was here to catch up with a friend. The food we ordered was salty & oily-but what can you expect, your at a bar. Will I be back? umm so call me maybe....
author: Kathy V.

description:
From the outside, this place looks great. Sleek tables, long bar, outdoor seating, and quiet upon entry. It's a different vibe than many of the bars on the street and I like variety in the neighborhood. Double plus bonus, it's right down the street. 

Unfortunately, it's really nothing special. The drinks aren't particularly spendy or cheap. There are no innovative creations offered. There is a good menu, which is expensive, but somehow still almost offensively bad when it arrives. For example, the "vegetarian" spring rolls included meat and were essentially three taquitos cut in half for $8. Not worth it, not even for bar food. 

Service was slow and inattentive. Televisions were distractingly loud. 

Go across the street to Hunan or around the way to Broken Record. Both are much better.
author: Brittany B.

description:
I have been going to this place regularly and Bottom's Up is a great place to have a chill, fun, and amazing night with some music. There's usually a live DJ on the weekends bumping classics and club bangers (Hip-Hop & EDM). This place is definitely one of my go to bar/lounge in the Excelsior area. I love the venue, there is plenty of tables for seating and standing. Also has out door seating, if you prefer fresh air throughout the night.

One great thing about this place is the staff, the bartenders are extremely nice and attentive. One thing in particular that I really enjoy is that fact that even though the bartenders are busy behind the counter, they will not forget to step out and check on the patrons seated at the tables.

If you ever happen to feel the need for a drink and in the area, then hit up Bottom's up and if you're lucky enough to go at a night when Shirley, Cindy, Ana, or MaryAnne is working then you'll be taken care of for sure. Also keep in mind that the whole staff is amazing.

I'm also very interested in seeing how the upper level lounge will turn out.
author: Wailan M.

description:
A strange set of occurences led me to Bottom's Up. I've passed by this small neighborhood bar plenty of times, but it never caught my attention enough for me to actually go inside and have some drinks. 

I was eating at a restaurant nearby one evening and me and my friend were discussing where some nice neighborhood bars are. A lady at the table behind us, I assume was the owner, taps me on the shoulder and tells me that I have to try Bottom's Up and I won't be disappointed. 

A few days later I'm ready to pull the trigger and check it out. Saturday night; place was busy, but not too packed, live DJ spinning, and very nice decor. I walk up to the bar to order drinks. Have you ever had an angel try to sell you alcohol? I folks, have been blessed to say that I have. MaryAnne was incredibly sweet and attentive, and service was very fast even on a busy night which I really appreciated. At that point, she could've sold me shots of chilled toilet water with lime juice and I still would've drank it. She has a smile and personality that makes you want to order ALOT of alcohol. (In a good way, of course) Woman, Please stop smiling and talking with your sweet delicious words before I die of alcohol poisoning.
author: Lyndon F.

description: Warning!! Please don't go there, it's my second time at this place, first experienced was bad! I thought it would be good idea have a drink with my Cuzin, since I was having bad day! I thought it will be nice order Hot Toddy (brandy and hot water) since very very cold.. The bartender name Anna just absolutely rude, customer service was horrible, well order our drinks and some food, before our drink were barely drink or the food arrival. She gave us the bill? Is she trying rush out? only 5:30-6pm ? Wait may I get another drink or some more food? It was not busy at all, only two people there! I feel like it can be racial thing?  it's Asian worker and Asian owner! I'm dark Latina, not mixed of with any Asian.. Very upset! Don't recommend going there, I will stay at my bar 7mile..
author: Raquel K.

description:
I once managed to spend all the cash in my wallet while having a tab open. 

They have awesome lychee cocktails and the last time they were there they had $5 shots for all their top shelf alcohol. I think it was top shelf. I don't know my alcohol. Whatever shelf Belvedere is on. 

Shirley is the best bar owner I've ever met and while I once laughed at Olivia Vanessa R's review "and my friends are always here...for some reason............" HER FRIENDS REALLY ARE ALWAYS HERE. Every single time I've been here, I've ran into one of her friends. Dafuq.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
What a shame. I planned to write this eye opening review about the terrible bar service, and see that others have had a similarly piss poor experience.

I met an old friend here for a drink after a long day since the bar was nearby. We were the first patrons, so we ordered drinks and caught up on life. I was digging the convo and she had the good vibes crackin, so I ordered another drink. 

As we finished the second round, the bartender (who had been pretty friendly when we were the sole patrons) asked us if we wanted more drinks. We said, "No thanks" with smiles. She then was adamant that we quickly close our tab and sign off. Ooookkkkayy. I paid and signed out, but why the rush? I realized a bit later that it may not have been our bartender who was an ass, but rather the head honcho lady who had just shown up minutes before.

For the next hour, we were asked by bartenders and servers no fewer than 40 times if we wanted to order more drinks or buy bottled water. When we kept refusing, we were asked to give up our bar seats. We moved to a standing table and were soon asked to give up the table. We gave up the table and were still told we needed (NEEDED) to buy something else as we stood in limbo. I explained politely that we had already spent money in their establishment (roughly $40), and we just wanted to enjoy the music and each others' conversation.

This apparently was a problem. At this point, I had the option to cause a scene or write this review. So here you have it.

I cannot in good conscience recommend this bar to anyone. Not now. Not ever. This is not how you run a business or treat paying customers once they decide they would rather chill out than get drunk and a DUI.

I had great company though. Otherwise I wouldn't have put up with the bar drama. We bought drinks. We were smiling and having a low key good time. "Why you wanna stick me for my paper?"
author: Gerald W.

description:
Stay away from this place 

They have extremely weak bartenders who make your cocktails very sweet with no alcohol and force you to drink and pay for it when you complain that it's too sweet and you don't like it 

The owner is rude, selfish, and doesn't care about customer service at all. You are just a dollar sign to her 

Let's not support a business like this because you should feel welcomed at a bar not unappreciated 
 
Oh yes prepare to surrender you ID when you open a tab since she thinks no one will pay
author: Eric S.

description:
Bottoms up, bottoms up, up, every single cup...

In Trey Songz' Bottoms Up song, he says, he gots a couple of bottles but a couple ain't enough. In our case, a couple of drinks at Happy Hour wasn't enough so after dinner last Wednesday, my friends and I ended up at Bottom's Up. 

Bottom's Up is an Asian Bar that's located in the unassuming Excelsior. Unlike the neighborhood Asian bars in the Sunset and Richmond that are very divey, Bottom's Up is modern, chic and a bar/lounge that would imagine be located in SoMa. It's sports bar meets ultra-lounge with leather booths, fluorescent lighting and multiple flat screen TVs. 

PROS
*Spacious, clean and modern with outdoor front patio
*A plethora of specialty cocktail choices 
*Reasonable drink prices (~$7 for top shelf liquor shots, specialty cocktails are ~$9-$10)
*Food is available
*Crowd is more "mixed" than Asian Invasion to the max

CONS
*$20 minimum for CC's
*Jukebox ($1 for 2 songs). NO music if no one puts money in the jukebox. WHACKED!
*Sketchy area with tons of cops roaming around

Although they have a DJ spinning on the weekends, it's not a place I would spend my Friday or Saturday nights (too low-key and the crowd is a little too hood for me). I hear they have an awesome Happy Hour Deal: 2 drinks and an appetizer for $10 though so I'll definitely check that out! Bottoms Up!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Had to use my empty beer glass to get water from the bathroom for a drunk birthday girl. I ordered at 3 drinks for myself and they wouldn't give me tap water.
Their reasoning: "People come here from other bars drunk, and then they ask us for water." Baffled, I kept trying to ask different bartenders and cocktail waitresses, and they all declined me saying things similar. 
We had brought a group of 8+ and gave them some good business. After spending all my cash on drinks and tips, I had to regret it.
author: Priscilla F.

description: Wish I could put a negative star terrible service husband obviously in his late thirties didn't have his id but the whole crew of almost 40 year olds had Ids and just wanted a beer couldn't even get a glance guess what I heard about this place is true.... They lost my patronage and of all the Hispanics I know
author: Raquel G.

description:
I'm writing this review, so you don't have to later. Every now and then you just have to say no thanks. I can see how some people may like this place, but being a girl who loves good times and good cocktails - the Bottom's Up just didn't do it for me. 

On the night I went, the place was a little packed. No cover, but its no "ultra lounge" - it's a bar that looks like a club. A few things I noticed:

* My Manhattan was expensive, but it was very poorly made. I'm not sure how you can screw it up if you use quality booze. It was so bad, I had to ask what it was after taking a sip. 
* Bathrooms so dirty, I didn't want to hang my purse up besides use them. Why are some chicks so messy? 
* Drunk hoochies knocked over the Christmas tree that was on the dance floor. Tis the season!! 
* Police presence towards the end of the night looking for someone. They were not there to dance, after they showed up - I just wanted to leave. That's not my scene.

Luckily the location is convenient to catching cabs, public transportation and such. I was on my way, ready to forget that last stop of the night - until I realized that we all come across a "Meh" spot and they need to be reviewed too.
author: Rebekah T.

description: Bartender  dont know how to make a blue Hawaiian  i guess these bartender should go back for training also they use the wrong glass for a lemon drop wtf and try to tell me that this is how house drinks are made bull shit these girls just dont know how to make drinks period.... they suck !!!!
author: Carolyn D.

description: Two bars in one. Downstairs is more sportsbar with a dj booth and jukebox. The upstairs is more winebar with a fireplace. Wine tasting every two weeks.
author: Joseph W.

description:
Bottoms up is conviniently located at a short walking distance from my job! They usually show the latest sports events and the ambience is lively! Pretty excited to see how the second floor turns out after remodeling.

As far as snacks go, they have a wide variety of finger foods that range from $5-$10. Not a bad deal for a decent portion of flavorful appetizers. Not to mention the manager, Shirley, is the best! She will take care of you and make sure everything is copacetic. Easily one of the better bars in the area, if not the Excelsior!
author: Antonio P.

description:
Hidden GEM in the middle of the mission? I'm down for that

Parking sucks at times.

The atmosphere is chill and not really "club" and normally just 3-4 people working overall. Drinks are really fairly priced and service is some of the BEST! I think the owner works there too. Keep up the good music and the good drinks and i'll be back! =D
author: Kenny L.

description:
WORST. BAR. EVER.

Nothing special or interesting about this place. EXPENSIVE DRINKS! Club priced drinks, for a crappy bar on Mission. You're basically paying extra for a hole in the wall bar, that tries to pretend like its a top notch club downtown. Owner has crappy attitude, and tad bit discriminatory. The waitresses were really nice, tried to make us comfortable but it still didn't excuse the simple fact that it wasn't that great of a bar to act like such a douche to everyone.

We came with about 10 people for my birthday, spent about 500 on drinks alone. Owner comes and accuses colored people, our group, of hiding drinks in a water bottle she found near our table. Overreacts completely rude, and threatens to call the police. Basically we leave, say goodbye to our cool servers. And now I'm writing this to warn everyone about this bar. THERE'S BETTER PLACES OUT THERE!
author: Mileti A.

description:
Love the leather seats. The size of the bar is pretty decent and pretty low key when I came in (it was a Wednesday night).

Drinks are alright, but I prefer my drinks with a more buzz. Otherwise, it's not bad.
author: Erin H.

description:
Cheap with TAP WATER. My friend the birthday girl asked for a glass of water to go with the copious amounts of alcohol being purchased for her and they made her buy bottled water. 

Refused tap water to several of our party to try to push bottled water as the night went on.

Wish I was kidding.
author: Ian T.

description: A breath of fresh air in terms of ambiance in this neighborhood. Service was okay, surprisingly dead on a Friday. Music was bland despite having a cool DJ room. Drinks were not strong but I guess it was okay since this place is cheaper than my usual set of bars. My friend said this place is usually busier on like.. a Tuesday so maybe I should try this place again.
author: Ryan L.

description: Pretty small little bar with a cute outside seating. Didn't feel like it was too crackin when I went for a Friday night. Probably won't be back unless a friend hosts their birthdays or events there. There is an ATM machine inside if you need cash but I'm sure  they'll charge you for it. All female workers and the owner is worker as well. Friendly servers and there's standing tables as well as sitting ones.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Mostly go here for the food and ambience - Love their chicken wings, thai friend rice and garlic fries. This is also probably the fanciest looking place around this neighborhood :p

Watched the 2013 superbowl here!! Very very exciting. Too bad we had an unhappy ending :(
author: Nicole S.

description:
Not much of a drinker (or can't be a drinker = light-weight). Came here with friends, chilled, nothing too crazy. The bartenders are a little off, don't seem like professionals, but decent enough to know what the basic drinks are. Owner is nice, especially since I'm Chinese, it was easier to communicate so extra points for me.

Got a round of free shots from the owner so that was nice of her. The place is a bit neater than most dive bars, but somehow the lighting and music volume is a little off. Can't explain what is it, but it's definitely not well balanced.

Decent price.
author: Elaine Y.

description: We found the food to be actually inedible.  We tossed it out.  The waitress didn't seem to notice or care that our food was basically untouched.  Maybe we will return just for drinks, maybe not.
author: Meo K.

description: This place is a dump. They overcharged us over $50 and they kept telling g is that they have a minimum charge. The place is ugly boarded up and the employees are rude.
author: Harry S.

description: If I could give a zero or minus score I would.  The owner is a totally unreasonable B_T_H.  Based on the love her or hate her reviews, maybe she's bipolar.
author: Sam S.

description:
This place is super chill and parking's pretty easy. I usually park at the Bank of America, but if you do just make sure you get a little card to put on your dash from the bouncer checking your I.D.'s.


Really laid back, although my friend's boyfriend was not let in because he didn't have the right attire on. Which was weak, 'cause seriously Bottom's Up, it's not that serious. haha

But one thing that I think is hilarious, is my friend and my cousin just came from another bar/club downtown, but we decided to come here after just for funsies and relax. Turns out when my cousin closed her tab over at the other place, they gave back her card and I.D. and she totally didn't even think twice about it. So when she pulled her I.D. for the bouncer to see he looked at her and said "Are you serious?" and she was like "Dude that's totally me!" turns out it was an I.D. for an African-American male with dreads HAHAHAHAHA

On top of that, I guess the manager thought she was underage so he comes out and says "No, it's okay you can come in still." WOW Bottom's Up, you are awesome! hahaha

Other than that hilarious episode, the drinks are decently priced, the DJ isn't too bad and their "End-of-the-World shot" is crackin'!
author: Mellani L.

description:
This is the place to go with a bunch of friends if you want a no fuss good time. NO cover charge, fast service, good music and so are the drinks. Oh, and it's near El Farolitos if you have the late night munchies after a night of drinking. This is also the place where you run to your wallet the morning after to see how much money you blew the night before. And let's just say that I don't remember much the first time I've been here! As Jamie Fox and T-Pain said, I blame it on the alcohol.

Drinks I recommend: Shirley's Special, End of the world, Wet Dream
author: May D.

description:
$20 CC minimum? Really?! For many, this wouldn't pose as a problem. Me? I only need one drink to get good and happy. Call me a one hit wonder but I just think of myself as cost efficient (I'm recession friendly, ok.). What am I to do with 4 drinks that no one else in the group seems to want either (IKR, who says no to free drinks?!)? Fast forward an hour later, my friend has to carry me home. Luckily for him, I only live 2 blocks away. 

P.S. Can the music BE any louder? I know the crowd is young but is their goal to send us into senior citizen status by the age of 35? My hearing is already deteriorating at an unforgiving pace as it is! It was a night full of "WHAT?!" "I CAN'T HEAR YOU." "YOU WANT TO PEE IN A POOL?!?!" "OH. YOUR FRIEND'S AT THAT STOOL." Is that not sexiest conversation ever uttered in a bar, or what?
author: Jen L.

description:
although it looks nice. do not be fooled.
Shirley, the owner, chased a patron half a block around the corner to "scream" at him for spilling his napkin AND spoons on the floor?? who does that??

$20 minimum.
a SMALL shot of Jameson is $8. really? and a shot of well vodka was $7.50????

this lady is rude, everyone else seems to think she is sweet. but she's a scam. seriously.

the bouncer doesn't even check id's. snuck in with 4 girls that were 19 the other night and he didnt even look at the birthdate cuz the id's said they were all over 26. REALLY!!!??

the crowd was local but the employees, prices, and drinks weren't even worth a second thought. I will never go back and tell my friends to stay away.  The DJ uses that place to practice as he's not even a real DJ, just a kid with a hobby. no offense but the jukebox with music to choose from was way better than what he played.
author: David C.

description: Awesome place to kick it. It's Sunday, and it's crackin... Oops its Monday now.
author: Patrick G.

description: Still a fan of this place. Nice spot to go to if you feel like being low-key. Shirley still remembers my bf & I after not coming here for 2-3 years, how crazy is that. Chocolate cake shots are still bomb ! :)
author: Sara L.

description:
Asian owned bar in the Excelsior. 

Pros:
-No cover
-Covered outdoor seating where you can smoke
-Plenty of seating 
-Decently priced drinks
-Dice for drinking games (liar's dice)
-Late night Mexican food in the area

Cons:
-Usually pretty dead
-Waitresses can be a little clueless (didn't know what an IPA was)
-DJs not that great

Its not really a night out on the town, wildn' out kind of place. But its an ok place to kick it at. Clientele is mostly asian and 30 year olds.
author: Arthur C.

description:
Cool little neighborhood lounge to hang out at. The dj on a Friday night makes the atmosphere more club like, so if your looking for something more chill, come on an off night. Or if you are just looking to kick back, their outdoor patio is relaxed, a little cramped but at least you get shielded from the wind. 

Likes
 
- Cool modern decor, perfect for groups 4-8 in size
- Good hip hop music, I heard some reggae thrown in, a little Sister Nancy - Bam Bam works wonders in setting the atmosphere
- Cozy little outdoor patio to hang out with some drinks 
- Diverse crowd, I had never seen a 6'4" 250 lb black man in a kilt before this night. 
- Comfortable couches, This one Latina chick liked the couch so much she thought that she was in one of them Broadway strip clubs and was giving her man lap dances. Get a room and handle that.
author: Earl G.

description:
update: $28 gets you a Grey Goose tonic, a Belvedere tonic, a Remy & Coke and a Stella. Open-tabs only until 10pm. Minimum $20 on a CC-charge.

Finally got a chance to hit Bottom's Up...wait, that didn't sound right. Finally got a chance to try Bottom's Up...wait, that didn't sound right either. Finally got a chance to go into Bottom's Up...wait, that didn't sound right neither! Finally got a chance to go visit the bar at 4704 Mission Street. Phew! From the few times driving by, I've always thought it was a strip club until yelp-friend ABBY A. did a review on it. 

This is more of a bar/lounge/karaoke atmosphere, and definitely not divy IMO. On a Tuesday night, it was not crowded at 11pm, and there were more smokers "outdoor-seating" chillin' than were people inside. But, $9 for a Ketel One tonic, and same for a cranberry vodka tonic? Whoa! So will return, of course, but more likely for happy hours. The TVs had SportsCenter on at the time.
author: Peter L.

description:
"Give to the world the best you have, and the best will come back to you."  I better watch out since I just gave a pie in the face to the 2 people who organized an entire fundraiser for me from start to finish.  I'm a trouble making instigator.  They got even ... but it was so worth it.

While this place is sort of in the middle of no where .... and the store front next door that looked like a car drove into it scared me somewhat, the interior was classy and cool.  The outdoor patio was very nice and the entire establishment as well as it's regular patrons, owners and staff were all super nice and accommodating to our rowdy Thursday night group.

The drinks were made fast with a full bar and the food we had was also pretty tasty.  Next time though, they need to not run out of the blue moon by 7:30.  Next time though, I need to not start drinking at 6:00 and taking the name of the bar quite so literally.
author: Kathleen W.

description:
This place has just about all the requirements I need in a club/lounge.

- no cover
- no dress code
- no lines
- large, long bar
- dance floor
- great djs
- lots of seating and tables
- decently priced drinks
- right next to PLENTY of restaurants that are open late

Some things about this place that I do not like however ...
- needs more bathroom stalls (and they always run out of seat covers & toilet paper before the night is over, they should just leave extras in there)
- lack of bartenders (i know that you'll have to split your tips if you have more people, but cmon ... think of what's best for the people.)
- the $25 credit card minimum
- can't keep your tab open (so unless you buy rounds or buy a BUNCH of drinks for yourself, then I suggest bringing cash)

None-the-less this place is great and I'm sure that if it was somewhere closer to the downtown area that it would be packed every single night.
author: Pia V.

description: Good place to drink! I actually like the cocktails here. I think they taste pretty good haha. This place is good if you're bringing a couple friends to get together and drink and maybe act a little rowdy. There were a couple people who were yelling and pretty much busted their vocal chords all night which was kinda annoying. Still, definitely a good drinking spot. Plenty of greasy late night eats around too. But just saying, be careful with your belongings (if you catch my drift). LOL peace! :)
author: Xyzagal A.

description:
Bottom's up! Bottom's up! Need a drink?! Feelin alcoholic? Oh, it's only a Tuesday night? Dang you're broke?! Well...Guess what!  

- No cover charge.
- Hella parking available - street parking, don't pay the meter. Doh! It's after 6pm.
- Every weekday open until 2AM.
- Doesn't get crowded. Plenty of seats available.
- Nice chic, modern looking bar. Clean inside. 
- There's outdoor seating as well. 

Although....
- If you want to dance you may be the only one dancing? Oh well it's okay, you're drunk? Dance away because there's plenty of floor space...
- Don't care about there being no DJ, it's okay just put in coins in the jukebox or media player thing (on a week night).
- Don't be thrown off that this bar is in the Mission/Excelsior district. It's okay, it's safe here, haha. Really, people that go here just mind their own business and just wanna drink. 
- All types of age groups come so it's not like a random bar that alcoholics want to go to in the middle of the night. 

FYI the drinks here a made pretty strong, that's a super plus right there! So Bottom's Up!!
author: Christine F.

description: Nice local bar. I would have gave more stars if the bartender serving our table didn't reach into my wallet and try to grab all my money as well as grabbed my friends $15 in $1 bills while he was counting it. I believe her name was Maryanne. I hope the owner sees this. Other than that it's pretty chill.
author: Chris S.

description: Eh if you are a big enough group you can pretty much take over the spot if not you'll be around a bunch of Asian folk drinking Heineken or shots of chilled grey goose.,if you are alone your best option is to hit up pissed off Petes
author: Jared V.

description:
This is the local bar by my place. I use to go here at least once a week but I decided to either try other places or just don't drink weekly anymore. The bartenders are the best draw to this place. All Asian and cute looking. The prices for spirits and beer is a little high but there's no cover so that's always a plus. 

There's a DJ every Friday and Saturday playing mostly old school R & B and Rap. Sometimes they'll play some top 40 stuff but it's rarely these days. Their Happy Hour is pretty good if you're in the area and great if there's a sports game on. The bouncer on Fridays and Saturdays, Roberto is really friendly and does his job well keeping out the vermin and the under-age. These days I go there out of boredom and because I just don;t want to go downtown to drink. Free parking at the Bank of the America close by, you just have to ask for a parking permit when you get to the bar. 

Back in the day this place gets 4 and a half stars. These days only 3 for me.
author: Nathaniel S.

description:
Drinks are reasonably priced...strong too! During happy hour  beers are $3 until 8 pm. 

Three flat screens to watch the game, juke box (decent selection) and dj's Fri & Sat nights. They have events here and there too. They have bar food (chicken wings, spring rolls). You can park at the BofA lot (off of Ocean St) or street parking.

There's a lounge area right when you walk and is separated by glass windows from the actual bar area. 

Shirley, the manager, is friendly and also one of the bartenders, Lily (thanks for making my snake bite the way i like it) =P Mexican food a block down when you get the munchies!

The crowd is mainly in their 20's to early 30's. They do check id at the door on Fri & Sat. Cheers!
author: Lola L.

description:
It's my Neighborhood Bar! =)! 

There's always parking.
No Traffic!
No Lines!
No Cover!
No Excessive Crowds!
There's music.
DJ on Friday and Saturdays! 
No Dresscode! 
And its clean!!!

But FYI bring cash!
author: Catherine K.

description: An Asian bar in the Mission.. sort of random but the interior was definitely nicer than most "Asian" bars I've been to around the city. The bartenders were very nice and helpful when it came down to deciding which cocktails to order.. everything was good. One drawback is that you had to pay for music from the machine.. and I remember my friends spending a load of money on music since it was so oddly quiet. I like the outdoor area a lot but kind of scared of the neighborhood.. lol.
author: Tiff C.

description:
Nice, decent sized, Asian fusion bar in the Excelsior. Rarity


2 Bad Things about this bar/lounge/club: 

1.) Some of the bartenders are not proactive, they dont really ask you if you want anything from time to time. They expect you to stand up, wave your arm, scream on top of the music and flag em down. They should really be less passive and ask customers if they need anything some times. Not all the time, but when a guy been sitting there for a awhile with his finished drink, I think it's time to ask. Just my opinion. 

2.) The music is SO DAMN LOUD! I mean jesus. I know its a bar, but godamn, it gets to point where my eardrums hurts and I cant hear what the girl that is sitting right next to me is saying and vice versa. When you have to scream into the ears of the person right next to you every time, that means the music is too dam loud. I even saw the bar owner cover her ears.

Overall, it's a decent bar with nice ambiance. Mostly an Asian crowd. There's usually always street parking, but after 6pm, you can park in the BOA parking lot just across the street. 

Beer is average priced and shots are pretty expensive compared to other bars. But the bartenders here are always cute girls. (Good business strategy btw)
author: U L.

description:
DAM. 2 reviews for this place before me. I knew I should have written it when I first joined! 

Anywho. The lady who owns this place (Shirley) is such a sweetie. She used to card me like mad crazy because she didn't believe I was over 21 ( I'll take that as a compliment). She recognizes me now and always says hello and takes good care of me. =) If you catch her on a good night, she'll probably play dice games and drink with you. She's done it with my friends on other occasions.

It's a decent sized bar, pretty modern looking. They've got big screens and cute bartenders. My friend bartends here and she always always always tries to get me super wasted. The djs here mostly spin hip hop (one of the dj's is also my friend..)
Anywho. The drinks are good (yes, the bartenders here actually have gone to bartending school), it's a mostly Asian crowd, sometimes parking is a bitch but it's usually not that hard to find parking in this area that late at night.

So after you down a few, walk down the block to Guadalajara's to scarf down a burrito. Be sure to raid their salsa stand.
author: Susy C.

description: I want to like this place more. Staff is bubbly. DJ booth is legit.  I don't drink much, so after a couple drinks,  I drink soda or water. So the server brings me a soda in a small highball. Looks like a chaser. I thought it might have been gratis. Nope it was $3. Prior to this, we drank a few cocktails and many beers. Wtf. Also people smoke right outside the door - not my thing.
author: Cheryl D.

description: I come to this place for the beer and the garlic noodles which are always really good. The servers are really nice. My only complaint is that they have small TV's. I think bigger tv's could make a positive impact, especially for sports fans.
author: Carlos L.

description:
I'd really like to give this place 3.5 stars rather than 3 stars...

This place is a cool spot to hang out.  The bartenders are cute and they most definitely take care of you.  Of course, be sure to have your ID handy because once you step in, if the security dude isn't at the front door, you are getting carded once you order a drink.  

Anyway, the decor is chill as well as the atmosphere. There's a bunch of tables and chairs at the bar.  There's booth type couches against the wall with tables as well so you don't have to stand in the middle of the bar/lounge with just tables...you can sit too.  I went here with a bunch of friends to celebrate my birthday from a referral from a friend.  We decided to check this place out after dinner.  It was close to everyone's house so why not.

At first when we walked in, the place was pretty empty but that was okay because it was still early.  I tried to order my fave drink to start out the night slow...a pear cider, but to my surprise they were out.  Ah! How dare they?  Oh well, onto another drink decision.  My friends order me my signature drink...grey goose and cran and it was okay.  It was pretty heavy on the cran and light on the grey but it was okay..to start out with at least.  So after a few minutes my friends and I moved over to the table and chairs and hung out. Soon the place started getting crowded.  Despite this, the bartenders actually walked around and made sure everyone in my party was well taken care of.  Everyone's drink was filled and ordered and they make sure to even talk to you a bit while doing their rounds.  I loved it!

I love the atmosphere and the people at this spot.  The only negative side is that they ran out of my favorite starter drink and their drinks were a bit heavy on the juice rather than the alcohol.  The prices are also reasonable.  Other than that, the music was bumping, the company was great, the bartenders are nice and helpful...what else can you ask for from a chill place on Mission in San Francisco?

I will most definitely come back when I'm back in town.
author: Mia D.

description:
This is a cool little hang out spot if you're in the neighborhood and you're not into dive bars.  It caters to younger clientele with hip hop music and even some old school classics.  

One thing I found super amusing was the ATM was super sticky!  I could barely press the buttons down and when my bills came out, they got stuck to the machine and I had to work hard to get my money!

=) oh drunkies, I love you. But stop spilling your drinks on the ATM!
author: Eleanor L.

description: I generally have fun here because of the friendly environment. The owner is the same as the one at Would You Believe in the Richmond district. I haven't talked to all the bartenders but the ones I have spoken to have always been generally nice. There's hip hop playing all the time with a small dance floor. You have to get lucky to get a seat unless you go early on the weekends. It gets pretty packed on Friday and Saturday nights. It's a fun atmosphere :)
author: Connie Y.

description:
One of my favorite bars in the city, and that's saying something.  I love how it is in the Excelsior and out of the way of the usual Financial District crowd after work.  The happy hour special can not be beat, and the food is delicious.  I also love the atmosphere and decor of the establishment, it really brings a touch of ambiance to the neighborhood.

What really won me over was the lovely staff.  Shirley, aka: the Madame, is by far one of the coolest and friendliest people I have ever met.  She is always ready with a smile and a great story.  The bartenders are the most beautiful girls in the city, and are really down to earth and chill.  On the down side it brings in some creepers, but as long as they pay that is a genius business plan.     

I haven't been in a month or two, but I suddenly have the need for the happy hour special.
author: Chris C.

description: Be ware!! if your not drinking here you will not be served water here. I told little ms bartender here I was the designated driver and she still wanted to charge me for water.. I will never return.
author: Dom F.

description:
This place is great..

Kind of an asian scene, but there is a variety of people who come in. This place has super friendly customer service, three TVs that usually have some kind of sports on, and awesome music!

I come frequently with my friends. Drinks are priced like most other bars, moderate.. Since people will mostly be coming at night, parking should be okay. There is an outdoor smoking area, and tiny dance floor for all you drunk people who love to dance =) Did I mention how awesome their music is?? Very clean here, pretty good crowd.

Bottoms up, thank you for all the times I made a huge ass out of myself =p
author: Neek W.

description: I had the time of my life here, but felt like I needed to be carried out by a stretcher the next day. The dance floor is somewhat small, but people were getting cray with a dash of hyphy all night. Drinks were cheap and it was relatively easy flaggin down the girls at the bar. Parking was a little tricky.I would definitely come back..once my liver forgives me.
author: Jennifer F.

description:
I guess for the Excelsior, this place should get a five star rating.  But as compared to the rest of the bars in San Francisco, I thought it was mediocre.

First, the place stunk like stale cigarettes.  It hit me right in the face as soon as I waked in and I couldn't get that stench out of my nose.  Second, the first round of drinks that my friend and I ordered were "not in stock", even though the bottles were displayed on top of the bar.  And the last disappointment was that they "don't do happy hour on Friday".  

Sad.

Maybe I'll go back and try the food if I'm in the hood.  But for now, I won't make any special trips to Bottoms Up.
author: Angella S.

description: Finally decided to come here since it's in my neighborhood and was celebrating my graduation party part 2 here with friends and family. One of those small lounge places where you can come and have drinks with your friends. Theres a DJ that usually comes on the weekend who start playing around 10 pm. When you come inside, the lighting  at the lounge area has the low dim lights. but when you go towards the DJ and bar area, it's has more brighter and colorful lights. On other days, if you want music in the background, you'll have to pick songs that you want to hear from the jukebox which you have to pay for. I was surprise that this place was a quiet lounge especially on a saturday. My group made up half the space here since we were a big group. There were people here too who came here to drink but not as much. But the workers were friendly and the owner gave a free shot on the house since  she knew that i just graduated on the day we came. my friends and i order variety drinks here and everyone paid separately whenever we order a drink from the bar area so we don't gave to pay together. If you want to buy food to snack on while drinking, better buy your food somewhere else since they don't sell food. Other than that, parking around this place are decent if you come after 7 or 8 since most of business are closed and there's free parking meter. Its a good place to hang out if you want to get a drink yourself at the bar or chill with your friends at the lounge area. They also have TV too where they put sport shows. thats your other entertainment if you don't want to listen to music from the jukebox.
author: Julie N.

description: If I can give a negative star I would.  "Shirley" doesn't like Latinos at her business.  I'm a native of the Excelsior and she is so unwelcoming.  If you don't like Latinos in your business move to different neighborhood.  I'm calling of an official boycott of this rotten place.  Que viva La Raza!!!!!!
author: Phil B.

description: This got to be one of my favorite bar! It has an outdoor seating for smoking AND there's a huge seating for large group.  The bartenders are all girls and they don't look bad at all!
author: David T.

description:
i really like the ambiance and vibe of this place. if you come on a slow day, its nice to get a seat and to chat with your friends. the music is pretty good as well

 they have a extensive drink menu, i tried the drink temptation. i was definitley not tempted in anyway. it was watered down, there no hint of cranberry juice or alcohol in it. but the other drinks we tried, some kool aid one and daiquiri were pretty good. the drinks are decently priced around $6-8 a drink.

and to use card, you do need to have a $20 minimum
author: Stella J.

description: This place is mostly mixed crowd . They play hip hop music and you can watch sports here . They have a few tables and chairs for you to sit on at the bar . There's also an open space where you can stand or whatever . I actually kinda like this place . It's a nice place to just hang out , catch up with a friend , watch sports , and have a drink . The owner is very nice and their cocktails taste really good ... they're nice and fruity . Drinks are reasonably priced too ! Coming here definately beats going all the way to downtown .
author: Eileen L.

description:
Decently priced drinks. Hot girls bartenders. it can get very busy but I love the vibe here, it's usually really chill and relaxed.

It's pretty clean and the decor is nice.

They're actually a restaurant form 5pm to 9:30pm on most days except saturday.  Have yet to try the food but smelled really good when i dropped by at 9pm one time.

It's a nice local bar that i love to chill at.
author: Zu W.

description:
Wow I never knew how expensive bar drinks are nowadays but when you're a homebody like me with kids than you learn the hard way!!. 

$13.50 was what I paid for one Patron Marguarita!! WOW.. Did I just get ripped off?? *You sure did, said my heart but my liver was in control tonight so I brushed it off, went back to our table and drank my one shot mixed with lemon liqueur.

This place is still crowded as ever on the weekends with plenty of locals coming in for beer or to say hi to the owner.. *Hi Shirley!!  :)
She's definitely a sweet women who chats up everyone and makes sure everyone is having a good time while the DJ is mixing it up and folks shaking their booties on the mini dance floor. 

Outdoor seating for those who need their nicotine breaks or can't stand around in a stuffy crowded room. 

Street parking only available bc this spot is located on Mission Street.
author: Anonymous P.

description:
BAH! the stars are for the owner, shirley, because she's really sweet. also for the different drinks they have, although i feel like they're watered down because i was able to actually walk out of this place on my birthday.

the reason behind the negative two stars is the asshole bouncer who takes his job way too seriously. i almost didn't get into my own birthday party here because of him, and i spent most of the night trying to plead with him to let my folks in. 

first of all, why there was a line and bouncer is beyond me. this is a BAR. in the EXCELSIOR. there is no cover. there is no dress code. on any given night the place is packed with bikers. so you can imagine my surprise when i rolled up on a friday, ready to celebrate my birthday, and i was greeted with a huge line and a surly bouncer. my friends walked me up to the front of the line, showed him my ID, and asked him to at least let me in because it was my birthday. he rattled off some bullshit about how he couldn't let any more people in for the night because it's a firecode violation, when it seriously wasn't even packed inside. finally he let me in, and once a group of 10 of my friends left i asked him if he could let 10 more people in. makes sense, right? 10 people left. let some more people in. nope. we had to go directly to shirley and she told him to let 10 people in at a time. this pattern continued throughout the entire night. 

now that i'm living on the other side of the bridge, it's more likely than not that i won't be dealing with that crap again.
author: Angela L.

description:
I don't party much but this place was cool.  I'll keep this rating short and simple.

Drinks - fairly big.  lychee moji. tasted too much like lime.  they tried correcting it, and then it tasted like soda lol.
Food - garlic fries MMMMMMMmmmMM!  Chicken nuggets tasted like popcorn chicken from Quickly, which isn't bad! Thai fried rice was nasty, along with the thai angel wings.  
Decor - coool.
Crowd - on a Wednesday night, everyone except my party of 7 was wearing a baseball cap and/or a giants jacket.  I doubt they showered before they came too hahahahaaa..

What wasn't cool - after 10:00 pm, we had to pay our tab, and couldn't open another one.  It was pay as you order which is kinda weird.  Maybe cuz the 'hood you can't trust people to pay their tab.  We def would've ordered more drinks if we have a tab open.
author: Alice E.

description: Clean, spacious, yummy snacks.    Fun place to go to watch the games hear people scream and cuss.  It's easy to find parking around.  You may park in the BofA parking lot after the bank closes.
author: Tadaa T.

description:
Came here for a friends birthday. First thing I walk in and see florescent blue light bulbs glowing the place which was pretty awesome. They have a super long couch with tables and sweating. They've got the little stools for the other side. 
We got there fairly early so it was pretty empty. The waitress set us up at the end near the stage area. Partially bad because it lead to the hallway where the restrooms where.....
Got a few rounds of drinks going. Beers on tap, pretty good selection. Too bad they don't give shots of 151 anymore though. Got a few End of the Worlds for my friend and boyfriend. Got a few mixed drinks for myself. They pour a little light handed though. The drinks seemed a little watered down, mainly the Goose shot that I had....really didn't feel much or taste it for that fact. 

They don't take card if it's under $20 so we kept having to buy more alchie. Drinks are decently priced. 
 
Pluses about this place: They have the dice game, which occupied most of our night, but as soon as the DJ came in and the place started to fill out, we couldn't even shout over it to know what game we were playing anymore. 

Negatives- seems like there are a lot of lonely single guys who go there by themselves to creep on girls. Spotted a few of them and they tried to dance up on girls without them knowing. 

Parking was easy, street parking. But then again we got there early so we parked across the street. It's easy to spot the place while you're driving. 

Place is a tad small with the amount of people who were there by the time I left which was around midnight. 

I think you should try it, but be open minded. You may or may not like it.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Good place to come grab a drink and watch a game or come on a weekend and listen to good hip hop and dance.  Weekend nights this place gets busy!
author: Jon P.

description:
You can't polish a turd, and you can't add "club" to your name if you're a bar in the Excelsior and expect people to take you seriously. THIS IS NOT DOWNTOWN GUY! THIS IS THE OUTER MISSION. You are a stone's throw away from sketchy panaderias and a Safeway that gets invaded by pigeons (please refer to my update of this Safeway). 

My girl and I were meeting up with a group to celebrate a friend's graduation, but when we get there the bouncer tells me he can't let me in because of my baggy pants. I offer to pull my pants all the way up but he wasn't havin it. WTF! When did this dive bar turn into a "club"??? I remember this place being on the same level as The Dr's and Carlo's with patrons lookin like bikers in raggedy Bret Michaels clothes. 

We call our friend Marie outside and tell her what's going on. She is equally baffled (again, we are in the EXCELSIOR) and so she calls everyone outside. We're all going on about how stupid this is and then all of a sudden the cops roll up. I guess they were called to get us to leave their doorstep but as it turns out, Marie (whose graduation we were celebrating) knew one of the cops! So instead of kicking us out, he is talking to us and he even takes a picture with Marie. He then just says that it's ultimately up to the bouncer, who BY THE WAY isn't even dressed to abide by his dress code. He was in a big blue t-shirt with baggy black pants and a Giants cap. Yeah, way to enforce your dress code. Oh and Marie got her name shouted out inside the "club" but she didn't get to hear it herself because she was outside tryin to help me get in. 

Anyways I offer to go home to change because I do want to be there for my friend's party and I live nearby anyway. Get this though, the bouncer goes, "I heard you guys talking shit out there, I'm not going to let you in." ALL BUTTHURT! Acting all sensitive with his feelings hurt!!! LMAO!!! 

Why 2 stars for this review and not 1? Well the bouncer didn't completely ruin my night because after all we did have a good laugh about this for at least an hour after the ordeal. No one get hemmed up and to be fair, we did witness the bouncer turn down a group of Asians because they were wearing flip flops. And.... I'VE BEEN KICKED OUT OF BETTER PLACES THAN THIS!!!!
author: EJ S.

description: It's an okay bar/lounge to go to because its close to home, parking its usually pretty easy to find, there is no cover, and there's lots of seating area. But it's not a place I would willingly go to unless I'm tagging along with friends that want to go there because I think the drinks (at least the cocktails) are weak and not worth the price, the food (in the late afternoons) is mediocre, and the bartenders (being all girls...) always rather pay attention to guys than girls. I get that you may think men are more generous with the tips, but that doesn't mean you have to look past girls waiting at the bar and go directly to a guy who just walked up to the bar..
author: Katherine C.

description:
Yay! I'm a fan. 

Yesterday, was my first night out at Bottoms Up. I'm so close to the dayum bar, I don't know why I never made my way over! 

I'm sooooooooooo in love with their front patio - leather booths, ottomans, decorative throw pillows, tables, and ashtrays; the perfect space for smokers like me!!!! 

The decor throughout was nice, sleek, but yet....inviting! 

The bartendar - very friendly and attentive and during busy moments, she never neglected our table or forgot our order! LOVE THAT! I can't really comment on the bartenders skills on making drinks, as I only ordered Guinness on tap! 

Happy Hour Special - 2 DRINKS AND 1 APPETIZER FOR $10!!!! Who the helll can beat that???? Appetizer menu included buffalo wings, thai angel wings, garlic fries, and calamari. I'm sure there was more to choose from, but I just can't remember off the top of my head. 

Will I be back? YOU BETCHA!
author: E C.

description:
i don't often go to bars but my friend decide to drag me here after our late night dessert. the lady or owner is so sweet, outgoing, with a great sense of humor. 

oddly this asian bar is located in the mission and it can be scary after hearing all these news.. 

my experience here was pretty chill. i like the design of this bar and everything seem very clean. 

all in all, its a chill bar
author: Valerie N.

description: I don't know if it made any difference attending this place a few days before Christmas but I found this bar just to be okay; not so much the fact friends peer pressured me into finishing a tall glass on an empty stomach and wanting to somewhat reluctantly "keep it hood" because of the neighborhood we were in. This place has a clean decor but nothing crazy that would ruin sobriety. No cover, thank goodness. My friend's gf works as a bartender here too and I guess that's nice but the area is kind've small. Credit for the dim lighting, live DJs, full bar service, and the side lounge availability on the other half of the room. Yet for some reason the vibe was lackluster and rather more humorous for not so obvious reasons if that makes sense?
author: Brandon H.

description:
Ok so I have to re-do my review now that I had a better experience

I forget that I take for granted such a nearby bar, in fact the only decent bar by my house that could pass for a trendy bar in SOMA.

There are 10 small screens showcasing the basketball games and the baseball games, definitely adds to the score, so does the spacious outdoor smoking area that includes tables and comfortable couches and pillows and ashtrays

Definitely not watered down bullshit, but the drinks are really expensive, they cost as much as they do at my work but my work is a themed place so naturally they charge double, this place is an average bar. I also hate the $20.00 minimum on the card, I honestly feel like it's a damn rip off considering most bars have a standard $5.00-$10.00 minimum. I also didn't like how this one bartender in particular told me I couldn't keep the tab open and had to close it out by ten. I was kind of confused and thought to myself "don't bars stay open til 3?" Then it dawned on me, she wanted me to close out at 10 so she could get the tip because that was when she was clocking out. WOW, so not only did I give her a big tip but as a burden to me I would have to reopen the tab and still do $20.00 minimum. Wow, I felt hustled like, I was a 50 year old rich man named berk and just fell into the clutches of yet another golddigger. Thankfully this bar is both BOA AND Wells Fargo adjacent.

Even on really slow empty days it's a long wait to get one shot. "Ok, so I don't want it chilled anymore could you just put the pour spout on and put it in the damn shot glass, no sprite back either now I just want it" "WHAT WHAT WHAT DO YOU MEAN YOU'RE GONNA TAKE CARE OF THOSE 5 PEOPLE FIRST, I'VE BEEN HERE FOR 15 FUCKING MINUTES. I'M SICK OF LOOKING AT THE LOSING GIANTS SCORE GOD DAMNIT and I WANT A FUCKING CIGARETTE" 

I'm only kidding, the service is really friendly so it's hard to be upset, and I'm being unfair since I know how it can be to be understaffed and overwhelmed. plus my friend works here, did not know that, she is incredibly sweet. I wish I had braces like her. Knowing that she is an asian bartender with braces is probably gonna send like 10 of you horny males in this general direction isn't it?

Oh yeah they kick you out at 1:30 and they do this by shutting off the music and turning on the bright lights so the hot guy you're talking to see's how thick your makeup really is under the bright unflattering lights and then see's the pimple you desperately tried to cover. NOT MY STORY because 1.) the guys here are still under the impression Neil Strauss ways work and that they forget that it's a small bar so I sit in the corner and observe and see that they have hit on every girl in the bar before realizing they missed one, me, yeah, see ya, 2.) my makeup is not thick! lOL 

anyway I only come here because it's so close to my house, I can get a (expensive asssssss) drink after studying 8 hours of Anatomy and my friends are always here...for some reason............ but if I had the choice it'd still fall under

Better to Have Never Loved
author: Olivia Vanessa R.

description:
Being in this area always makes me think of ethnic studies classes and ethnic enclaves.  I parked around the corner and as I walked towards the door, I saw the seating area they have set up out front.  It's colorful.

It's a long narrow bar with banquette seating, a stage and a DJ booth in the back.  I'm not sure what the stage is for but it would probably work well for karaoke.  The beers on tap were limited and they ran out of Blue Moon early.

The food was ok and the service was interesting.  The owner, Shirley, was a sweetheart and really quick with everything.  She let some drunkies get behind the bar with her and the bartenders for pictures and also participated in the tricep push up competition that my lady friends seem to enjoy doing out in public these days.  We are all taking our fitness more seriously but I tend to save it for the gym when I am not drinking.

It was a good place to throw an event and it was fun to see my friends mixed in with the bikers and other regulars that rolled in later in the night.  I hope there are pictures.
author: Seong P.

description: It's a shame that I have to give this place two stars because honestly, I love small neighborhood bars.  This place really has potential, but last night was awful.  First of all, we were completely ripped off.  The drinks here are not cheap!  Wait a minute, I thought I was in the Mission, not Vegas?  What the eff.  If I want to spend that kind of money at a bar, I'll go to a nicer place.  Second, the staff was rude.  My friends and I dropped $$$ in this bougie establishment and you treat us like s#*^?!  Sorry, but you just lost a bunch of customers right there.  Third, the non-existent crowd was whack.  I didn't come here to be surrounded by arrogant a-holes all night.  Not sure if I want to come back here again.
author: C E.

description: Came here with my boy Victor,  some good tunes & the happy hour specials were nicely priced!
author: Timothy H.

description:
By the time I got here I was smashed.  Not that that is anything new.  Now that I think about it every time I've been here I've been drunktastic.  Perks are that Bottom's Up is right in my hood and they play really good music.  Maybe I was really drunk, but I swear the drinks were expensive the last time I was here.  And the guys will not leave you alone.  They pretty much cling onto you like a dog to a fire hydrant.  Boy does that feel good. Only rationale I can think of was I was the only blond.  Or drunk man math: I'm drunk, she's drunk = drunk magical music.  I think this place is fun.  I was amused.  

I will say there were tons of cops outside waiting to follow people to cars so be careful!  And don't drink and drive!
author: Justine D.

description:
So I stopped in here out of necessity again and lo and behold, the serivice was EXTREMELY warm and friendly! WTF?? Either the staff at Bottoms Up had a personality makeover, or for my initial review, I had caught them on a bad night. Either way, I'm bumping them up to four stars.

That said, Bottoms Up is actually a pretty decent lounge. Classy and modern, but not off-putting. They have four widescreen televisions to satisfy the sports fan. Their deep fried ravioli is exquisite as are their angel wings.
author: Alex H.

description:
The atmosphere is very chill. Everyone seemed to know each other & know the owner. The bartender came up to our table so we could order our drinks. The drinks were okay nothing to rave about. I really like the inside, I mean the tables were the cleanest I've seen in a bar or lounge. The music was hip hop for the night & played at just the right level though she did turn it up and no one was really dancing. Overall it was a good experience. No one was pushy to keep buying drinks or anything like that which I liked. My friend and I were just sitting back enjoying a couple drinks. I would go back with more people.

Note: The prices seemed to change even for the same drink in the same night but didn't ask questions. ?
author: Sarina I.

description: I didn't enjoy the location of this place, but the interior was definitely a lot nicer than what I expected. The drinks here are really cheap; I got a margarita with house tequila for around $5. They had to close out tabs early though because they were so busy. The waitresses were all very nice, and they had enough dice for 7 people to play drinking games with! +1 star for that. Also, there are plenty of yummy authentic eats around if you get the munchies!
author: Rose Y.

description:
Came here Sat night after a slow night at Firefly. I've been here once before and had a good cocktail drink but can't remember what it was called.

This time, we just had beer. It was pretty packed in here with a mixed crowd. There was young people and then people that were too old to be in here.. at least that's what my friend and I thought. 

Way too many old Asian males flirting with the bartenders and checking the females out. They need to keep their eyes to females their own age cuz it's really disgusting and freaky.

The bartenders were nice and I liked how they walk around once every 15 min or so to see if everyone is OK and if they needed more drinks. But I think the owner or something needs to wear some more clothes and cover up instead of wearing a skimpy floral hoochie shorts with a lace tank.
author: Juliane N.

description:
I come here once in a while when I'm in the area. To sum up everything:

- Plenty of street parking.
- Decent drinks that can be inconsistent. I've had some that tasted watered down and some made just right. Just depends who's making it.
- Bathrooms are.. decent as well. Not disgustingly dirty like some of the other bars I've been to, but I wouldn't exactly say they were clean either. The actual bar area seems pretty clean, though. 
- DJ on Fri/Sats, which can get pretty crowded, but dead on every other day.
author: Kari G.

description:
I had low expectations for this place (because of the neighborhood), but I was pleasantly surprised by it's trendy and modern decor. It's very spacious with plenty of seating. As a "smoke when I drink" smoker, I loved the outside lounge area with the cushy seats and tables. There's also a plexiglass on one side to keep us smokers warms and cozy.

Service from the 1st bartender/server was good, she came to our table and remembered all our drink orders and special requests. The garlic fries were yum, but the Angel Wings came as Buffalo Wings. The Thai fried rice was barely eaten and the deep fried calamari was waaay salty.  Stick to the fries and drinks. Their lychee mojito was pretty decent, except you'd probably have to drink 10 of those for a buzz.

Our 2nd server was not as attentive and mostly stayed behind the bar area. Our mojitos came super limey so I asked her to add something else in it, like alcohol. She goes "We already measured two shots into it". Seriously?!! Well, it's not our fault there is too much lime juice. Do what you need to to make it better. She did look 15 though, so she probably didn't know much about customer service.

Here's something LAME: Can't have open tabs after 10p or 1030p. HUH?! I guess their patrons usually pull runners...
author: Freckles H.

description:
During my 7 month stint living in the Excelsior District, Bottoms Up became a standard for me when I was bored with nothing to do... My first time there, the owner was the bartender and was nice enough to go over the food menu with me... Unfortunately I was there after food service so I couldn't order anything.  I tested the bar by ordering a Mojito, and I was surprised at how good and strong it was since I was no where but a 5 minute drive from my house... Upon entering Bottom's Up, you would be surprised that such a place existed in our corner of the Mission, just because there hasn't been a bar this sleek EVER here... 

So ladies, yes this place is a meat market.. you should come down and have a beer while watching Monday night football here... IF YOU ARE LOOKING... hahaha.
author: Chrysantha C.

description: Chill spot,  a little pricy, good music.
author: Luis M.

description:
Hey, this place was reviewed before me dammit...

This is a pretty cool place...feels a bit too asian for me sometimes though, I prefer diversity in my establishments...

Parking can be horrendous, but what place has good parking?

I also love the music there...it was mostly hip-hop each time I have visited...

And a big plus for cute bartenders...
author: Mike V.

description:
Love this place: In a nutshell, reasonable drink prices, strong drinks, cute/friendly/knowledgable female bartenders, great interior & outdoor patio,  great calamari, always good music & a nice owner

Credit card minmum is $25....no one likes a minimum, but c'mon $25 minimum is WAYYYYYYYYYY easy to meet. Had a girls' night here recently and had a great time-we sure did keep the rounds coming and def spend $$$. The owner comp'ed a round ($50 worth) and was verrrrrrrry great about it-she didn't have to. 

check it out. great times
author: Dessa R.

description:
This place is ok. Their drinks have very unique names, but sure is pricey. The inside is very nice as well as the outside. Love Shirley, the owner. The music needs to be better. It does tend to get crowded on a good night, to the point where you bumpin 'bows (elbows) wit everyone. My coworkers and I ate here after a long day at work was shocked wit the price. The food tastes like any other food you've tasted, but more expensive. Dress code is chill. I would come here because its in the neighborhood and very clean. 

By the way, try their DRAGON EYES. its good.
author: Abby A.

description:
This is like the perfect place to go to if you are a sucker for living in the past.
What do I mean? Its like the perfect place to go to if you were still in High School, or slightly under 21 years old.  

You have the generic DJ bumping 90's and pop hip hop music from his Ipod (now dont get me wrong, most bars practice this technique, its just a grip i have in general).

The beer selection is average, as well as the prices.  
I do like the the style and set up of the bar.  I enjoy the choice of bar tenders (cute women) and the proximity.  Its a comfortable spot if you dont want to go through traffic, struggle for parking, gas, and the general hassle of going to the City.
author: Riko H.

description: This place is WHACK!!! Ordered shots of Goose and tasted nothing but 70% water!!!! I suggest that NO ONE to go here cause this place is a straight up hussle. They get one star for the outside area and the DJ that is there. Otherwise.....NEVER AGAIN!!!!
author: Taylor W.

description:
This place is a GOD SEND for the Excelsior District/Outer Mission!!! Let me tell you, you've gotta check it out. It's like Would You Believe, but much closer to my house and bigger. They've got hot bartenders, a good sound system, plasma tvs, and the people there are always cool. Plus, there's El Farolitos a couple blocks away! How can you beat that?

Oh, and about the parking issue. Last time I checked, you can park in the Bank of America lot (it's on Persia, right off of Alemany) and ask a bartender for a plaque to put on your car so they don't tow it. I don't have the parking issue cuz I live so close. Sorry!
author: Axel G.

description:
this place is wiggedy-wiggedy-WHACK! my sis and i went here for st. paddy's day (i know...it's not an irish bar, but it's so close to our house!) and they charged us $30 for two lychee mojitos. THIRTY DOLLARS. 

"for $30, there better be a pot of gold at the bottom of this drink!"

the bartender asked us what kind of vodka we wanted in our drinks. who puts vodka in mojitos??? (faux pas #1) this should've been our cue to get the hell outta that bar, but we went with it. granted, my sister asked for grey goose, but again, $30...for two drinks...REALLY?!

faux pas #2: she took HELLA long to serve us our wrongly made, overpriced drinks...conversing with her fellow bartender first, probably about how much they thought they could get away with charging us. shady.

faux pas #3: the mojito? tasted like sprite.

faux pas #4: she was wearing G-unit cutoffs. definitely hating, but i had to mention that, as my sister kept bringing up that bartender's taste in apparel. 

i just realized, though, they may have charged us extra because she's trying to upgrade from G-unit to lady enyce. who knows? all i know is i won't be coming back here.
author: arpee q.

description:
Just like any other bar, but i'm guessing they just remodeled. It's pretty nice inside. 4 flat screen TVs.. nice tables, but the pricing is way to high... 14 dollars an incredible hulk.. wow... expensive! 

They don't even give you free snacks to munch on. Another thing, they don't allow you to open up a tab.. pretty stupid. 

I like the outside patio/smoking area. 

3 stars.. seems pretty fair.
author: Brian P.

description:
