Im the doorman at this spot been doing it for a lil while but so far its ok. the crowd can be a lil too asian sometimes but most nights its a mix crowd. the parking issue can be solve by asking me for a placard to put on your dash and park at b of a. come through hang out have some beers talk to the hot ass bartenders and listen to some greta music. 


p.s they are serving food now from 5 to 10 pretty cheap.

***update:** doorman and chef both called it quits......im at club suede again come by ill take care you jsut look for the only latino guy wearing black outside.
author: Jared V.

description:
I came here once about 1-2 months ago. This is a nice place. I love the interior and the atmosphere. Some complain about the loud music. But I didn't find it too be that loud. The Asian bartenders were hot and attentive. They have a semi-outdoors seating, and it's great when it gets too stuffy inside. The prices were decent.

I would definitely come back here again.
author: Sam W.

description:
A nice, clean bar in the Mission. Who would've thought.

The $10 happy hour special (from ? to 8pm) is a good deal. It includes 2 drinks (beer or well) and an appetizer. The only catch is that both drinks have to be exactly the same, so choose wisely.

Appetizers, ranging from $5 to $9, can also be ordered off the menu. The six of us had calamari, hot wings, angel wings, popcorn chicken, garlic fries, and fried zucchini (yeah, we're pigs). Nothing particularly memorable, just standard, good deep fried bar fare.

This cute little establishment has modern decor with fresh paint, 4 flat screens, and clean bathrooms. I especially liked the smoking area with seating set up like the inside of the bar. Good service from the cute bartender with blonde hair and a sleeve tattoo.

Perfect place for sports enthusiasts. I will definitely be back!
author: Cindy L.

description:
Considering this bar is in the most random spot ever, they certainly have a lot of patrons. Half of them are the Filipino guys I went to school with. The bartenders, all four of them, were very nice and friendly. They even changed the channel on one of the TVs for me and my fiend so we could watch the Olympics. 

I only had beers and a Tom Collins there but it was made well and decently priced. The DJ was pretty good but I was too busy ODing on the Olympics' opening ceremony. I also really like the patio because you can lounge and enjoy your cigarette instead of standing and shivering in the cold. 

Minus one star because who knows who the bouncer thinks he is... 

bouncer: *looking at my ID* This ain't you!
me: uhhhh... yeah it is.
bouncer: if I say it ain't you, it ain't.
me: o.O
author: Janelle B.

description: Everytime I come here, I have a great time!  They have good happy hour, $10.00 for 2 well drinks and an appetizer or $3.00 beers!  Cant go wrong with that!  A cool, chill spot, you dont need to get all dressed up or worry about a cover charge, they have about 4-5 TV's, live Dj (sometimes) and friendly barttenders. Its a hidden little charm in the Mission
author: Gizzy S.

description:
Upshot: it's a nice spot, great decor and atmosphere and the music and drinks are also really good. Downside: no credit cards, cash only which makes the binge drinking kinda' tough. This is a great neighborhood spot when you don't want a DUI and you want the SOMA experience. Friendly and cute bartenders and DJ music on the weekends make this a favorite local club/lounge. 

Free parking at Bank of America lot if you ask for a parking pass so don't let the lack of parking deter you.
author: Cristy J.

description:
Perhaps I went on a bad day, but my friends and I went to Bottom's Up on a Saturday night and um, strangely, besides us, there were like, 5 other people.

Granted, this place looks pretty cool from the inside and has a decent set up, it weirded me out that on a Saturday night, there were almost as many bartenders as there were patrons. 

So to make up for the fact that there were no other people in the bar besides my friends and a creepy loner guy sitting behind me at the bar, my friend and I ended up taking shot after shot to ease the loneliness - I mean, pain =P haha. 

So if you saw a super drunk Asian girl last Saturday.. that would be me.
author: Peggy T.

description:
It's an alright spot in the Excelsior.  A clean and cozy "small" setup with a live deejay.  The music is koo and most of the bartenders are friendly.  Multiple televisions and lounge seats available for chillin' and watching the "game."  

Unfortunately, the drinks are OVERPRICED and it's usually a sausage fest.  It may be due to some of the bartenders being cute AZN girls, haha.  This place definitely has their "usuals" that you'll see any time you hit up the bar every other month.  

Bottom line, Bottom's Up is an okay spot if you're unable to hit up any of your 5 favorite spots first.
author: j f.

description:
Here's what I like about bottom's up:

1. No cover charge or dress code

2. Close to home (I live in Daly City and this place is less than 10 minutes away)

3. Good music
author: Michelle F.

description:
They remodeled the all you can eat Mediterranean place that has the cool Persian facade and turned it into a modern hybrid lounge/sports bar with a sweet-ass DJ booth and small stage for bands. 

Cute girls tend the bar but don't let their sweet looks fool ya, some good cocktails have been brought to my table outside. Yeah, outside! They could use a few heaters so more people can enjoy the booths that are setup but get cozy and you will be sure to warm up. 

Prices are normal, drinks were good, and the service rocked. A few weirdos make it inside but it's mainly groups who take over part of the place or guys watching games on the 5 HDTV's they have placed around the bar. It reminded me of the bars you would find in Singapore but in this case there is only this one in a part of town you would not expect such a modern place. It's a trip and the owner, Shirley, is pretty cool.
author: James T.

description:
A nice spot to hang out with friends on weekday and/or weekends. The music and drinks are really good and they have great decor. The owner and the waitresses are nice & friendly. 

They have an outdoor patio where people can smoke or you can hang out inside the bar. They also have 4 flat screen TV's so you can watch the sports.

They also have free parking at the Bank of America next door if you get a parking permit from Bottom's.

It's cool they provide games with the dice and a cup. I was trying to figure how the Cantonese people play this game. All I can say it's difficult to learn & understand.
author: Jenny K.

description: Can some one say HOOD FAB!!!!!! Not in the best neighborhoods but the place once inside is fairly nice. The one drink I decided to have was extremely stiff and the bartenders were very nice and hooked up proper. The downside is the crowd. Too hood for me and I felt like I needed either some dreds or some baggy ass Roca wear jeans..
author: Richard G.

description:
this place was pretty crackin on saturdays compared to thursdays..all my friends rant about how this place is one of the better bars, its fun, blah blah,.... i decided to check it out for my friends birthday. the bartenders were cool, the bouncer was nice, dj was on hit with the songs, and the place was decently clean with a good seating amount for a bar.

only four stars because the owner was a bit nuts when she had about 50-75 people waiting outside the bar just to get into the place because she felt it was too "packed".. i mean what is this, a club? she basically kicked out the cholos, cholettes, thugs, thugettes, etc.. which was good for us, but the waiting out in the 35degree weather in a ghetto ass hood for 20 minutes was not crackin..nonetheless, def good time, it was better for us i guess because by the time we got in, it was pretty cleared out for our party to start "popp'n". 

def would go here again, no doubt.. but beware parking is a nightmare..check out BofA round the corner for some playa parkin.
author: Em C.

description:
3.5 STARS. Been to this bar quite a few times. Not a bad place, sometimes parking can be hard. Overall not a bad place, beers are cheap and they have a wide variety of mixed cocktails. On top of that, the food menu isn't too shappy either. You'd have to check it out for yourself. 

Oh yeah one thing, they only accept credit cards during food hours.
author: HENRY M.

description: This place has a pretty good deal for happy bour. The apps aren'nt that great.  But they're cheap.   Watch out for dj nights,  if u put $ in the jukebox amd the dj comes on, they will NOT give you ur money back!
author: Tara R.

description:
I'm surprised to read other folks' reviews.  My BF and I came here right after we moved to Excelsior, and we were kind of disappointed.  We arrived about 8 or 9:00 on a Friday and were the only patrons of the bar for about an hour, when a few other people trickled in.  We had some really good drinks, but they weren't cheap.  We ordered some food, but it seemed like it was just frozen appetizers heated up and put on nice plates.  The service was fine, and we stayed a while, but overall we spent about $70 and didn't have that great a time.

I guess I need to go back to see Bottom's Up on a more happening evening.
author: Arminda K.

description: I love this bar. I mean not only is the place chill, middle of the street, dress casual right down to wearing shorts casual place I've ever been to. The bartenders are great. Whether coming here by yourself or even in big groups. Bottom's Up has style. It's not the best place to be dancing on the  floor near the DJ. But the price of drinks and the laughter that follows are great. Parking may be an issue but I don't really care. I must admit for Bottom's Up, they have plenty of seats, chairs, tables and sofas to go around.
author: Matt B.

description:
151 and tonic?  or was it 151 and coke... does it matter?  If downing a shot of 151 puts hair on your chest, sipping 151 puts hair on your....

I was not the one crazy enough to order that drink... my liver can't handle that kind of punishment anymore.  Props to you sir for sipping 151... black magic... evil motherf...

I like Bottom's Up because it is very spacious and it still looks very new.  Lots of space up at the bar.  And there's plenty of space to lounge around the bar.  There's a patio area at the front and there is a DJ who usually spins hip-hop in the back.

And the bathroom is nice enough to pass out in if you happened to shoot down too much 151,
author: Sam T.

description:
So I came here for the first time last night with the roommates. I'd heard about this place for about a year, but never went because the lines I saw on Friday and Saturday nights was a turn-off. Well, I will be coming back here more often on the off-nights (Monday-Thursday and Sunday). The decor and outdoor/indoor lounge area is very warm and inviting, with pillows and comfortable seating. 

The bar is very sleek, and every liquor you can imagine is stacked neatly and visibly. The bartendress was very sweet and welcoming, and even comes outside every 15 minutes or so to check on you and make sure everything is OK. The only downside is that the jukebox machine doesn't give you much bang for your buck: you get 2 credits (or 1 song) per dollar, but your song choices *DO* increase with every dollar you put in (you get bonus picks). Also, the drinks are extremely overpriced. I know they have to keep overhead, but I also think bigger glasses are in order if you're going to charge high. 

Overall, this is a great place in the otherwise working0-class Excelsior to feel "grown and sexy". This is my new neighborhood bar...
author: Maurice R.

description: I like this place. I come here a lot with some of my friends thru out the week. They good music over the weekends. The bartenders are all girls and they're cute (some of them). If you're trying to holla at some girls, I don't know if this is the spot cause there are too many guys here sometimes cause of the bartenders. But if you just want to have a drink or kick it with a chick, this spot is coo.
author: ben s.

description:
Recently, after a gig I got cajoled by some friends who live in the City to show up to this bar for some Chinese Earthquake Relief event.  I parked in the area, but I felt slightly uncomfortable walking down the streets in my concert attire (a suit) and wearing my class ring (probably, the most expensive thing I own).  Sticking out like a sore thumb while dressed to the nines I was silently praying that I won't get mugged.  This is coming from a guy who lives in Oakland.

Personally, I thought this place was going to be sketchy, but it turned out OK.  It bar was nice and I had a decent time, but in a way this was very San Francisco.  There were some thuggish, fobby Chinese dudes playing liars dice at the bar and all of the bartenders could speak Cantonese, even though this isn't a "Cantonese" bar by any stretch of the imagination.

Yeah, this place is slightly thuggish, and slightly fobby but I wouldn't mind coming to this place again.
author: Kenny L.

description: The bouncer wouldnt let me in, and the place was half empty. This is a racist bar. dont go there....!!!
author: Jenny W.

description:
I love this place.  Drinks are reasonably priced and are delicious.  Good place to kick it after work!

It can get a little too loud at times though, but you can just ask them to lower it.

Very nice bartenders as well!
author: Chai S.

description: much like the Chug Pub this place is mainly a hangout for asian ppl.....not a plus for me cuz im not particularly into asian chix..to make it worse, .guy to girl ratio is usually 10 to 1 and that includes the bartenders.....owner/manager name shirley who seems to have severe anger/control issues.......
author: Sang L.

description: If I could give zero stars....I would.  My friend and I came to check this place out last night because we live nearby and were excited to hear they have a thursday night special with $5 shots.  Everything was going fine (nothing great, kind of dead) until the special was about to end (10pm) so the owner offered us another drink before the cut off.  We accepted her offer, and as she goes to poor us the shots, she replies "by the way, you took too long, they are now $7"  I understand its only $2, but c'mon now, really?? Why even offer?? I then declined the shots strictly out of principle of her trying to hustle us for 4 extra bucks.  And then,to pour salt on the wound, she refuses to close us out b/c our tab was $19 (literally) and they have a $20 CC minimum.  Are you kidding me?? How cheap can you be??? Both incidents she blamed the computer system not allowing her to make an exception.  Funny that I have worked in restaurants using the EXACT SAME system, and I happily offered to give her a lesson on how to "make the exception".  This pissed her off even more, along with the other little hookers behind the bar (tip: bartenders in booty shorts in January is NOT cute) Its like, be serious, you obviously have two very upset customers yet you continue to penny-pinch your way into getting an extra couple dollars.  Do you not realize that you just lost two potential customers that over time would have spent MUCH MORE THAN $5.  Thats basic math and basic principles of customer service.  Moral of my rambling:  I WILL NEVER EVER EVER STEP FOOT INTO BOTTOMS UP AGAIN, AND I RECOMMEND YOU DO THE SAME (unless you  like to get hustled, which by the sound of many reviews, I am not the first)
author: Justine S.

description:
This bar is really chill.  Outdoor smoking patio, plenty of seats (though can get packed at peak time), renovated interior, flat screen TV's, DJ booth, good music, and good well-priced drinks (but cash only).  The owner is nice too and so far I have yet seen people fight or puke.

I take Alemany from Daly City instead of Mission to avoid cops, muni, shady looking people, and traffic lights.  It's literally 2 minutes away from my house and there's always parking.  Just don't walk the streets alone.
author: Fotos C.

description: Kind of mixed feelings about this place, but some things definitely need work for sure.  I didnt even pick the place, it was just where my girlfriend, some of her friends, my sister, and me met up for some drinks one Friday night. Seemed like your typical asian run bar, where you pay for atmosphere and views of the bartender more so than the quality, or knowledge thereof, of the beverage itself. So when I was talking to the newbie bartender in training, I kinda figured she didn't know much about beers when she recommended an IPA for a pilsner or lager.  That's ok, she's new to the biz, she's still learning, I've met experienced beer and shot bartenders who thought simple syrup and triple sec were the same thing.  The thing however that got to me was the older lady who seemed like the manager/owner responded with the exact same response when she tried walking me through for recommendations for a second round of beers! I'm not a snob by all means, but as a customer and beer enthusiast I'm insulted that wrong information about alcohol is being thrown around so carelessly.  Another thing was my sister and me felt like we were splitting a shot when we ordered 2 Makers neat. Nothing wrong with measuring shots, but get better glassware that can hide the fact you're being cost conscious. One thing I will appreciate was their willingness to try to be helpful. They don't have a list since they do have a good selection on draft to make both of our jobs easier when it was busy, but at least tried to walk me through it even though no one really actually knew what they were talking about.  They also were willing to redo my sisters guiness when they gave way too much foam at the top (like 2 inches btw) no attitude or questions asked.  So if I do come back here for whatever reason, I'll just go for a beer.
author: Sanger S.

description: this one my favorite local bar if you want to get away from the rest, its just a few block from my but i still had to drive out there, haha... never really had a problem with service either, mainly order our drinks and chill outside in the smoking area until closing....
author: JessePanda C.

description:
I was kinda weary of coming here after living so close and driving by many times and looking like there was nobody inside, but the outside half inside balcony deceives you! The inside is usually nice and moderately full, the drinks are decent priced. The night we went we kinda knew the bartenders so the drinks were off the hook. Music wasn't the best in the world, but there is usually some cut rate coming up DJ trynna make a name spinning there. The bartenders are scantly clad and one of them looks like the mother of the rest! LOL!!

Pretty chill place, but dont come with the wrong attitude, I hear of fights breaking out here and there.. at least when I went there was some decent action!!!! LOL
author: Eric A.

description:
I've been coming to this place on and off for over a few years now and I use to come here at least once a week and then it became once a month and last night I remember why I refused to go to this place. I live 10 blocks away so it's nice having a bar I like close to home but last night was the last straw. 

Don't get me wrong, I use to love this place. They have drink specials on weeknights before 10pm. $10 gets you 2 drinks and an appetizer. The food is decent and the drink prices aren't that pricy. 

When we sat down we got served right away, we ordered 4 Patron shots for $34 which isn't a bad price, but asking for it chilled wasn't that great of an idea I guess because they were a bit watered down. I use to serve liquor so I still know how to tip. We gave her $8. Our first waitress was decent, she was nice, checked on us often esp when we needed drinks, she was there. 

We started to playing a drinking game where it required a lot of beer, I wanted Blue Moon but they ran out at 1030pm! So we ordered 4 Heinekens instead and the price we were told the first time was $14 by the same waitress. After 2 rounds of that, we got a new waitress and she started serving us 4 more rounds of 4 Heinekens and she started charging us $18 for each round. May I remind you I still tipped these girls $5 or more every round not knowing the 2nd waitress was charging me more because after 2 rounds of Patron and 2 rounds of Heineken and drinking before I got there, I was a bit faded. During our last round we ran out of cash and we needed to pay with a card and I went to the bar and handed them a card and the first waitress tells me theres a card minimum (and by the way, they don't take American Express!), so I tell her to add another beer to the tab to make it over $20 (thinking it was $18) and she tells me I have to add 2 beers because it's only $14 and I turn to the other girl and say, "Well she's been charging me $18!" What upset me the most was the 2nd waitress tried to charge us twice. My friend found cash in his pocket and paid her while I went to the bathroom and then tried to pay her with my card... Are you serious?! After that I stopped tipping. I hate being taking advantage of esp when I did nothing but tip these girls over 20%. 

One of them actually came over started to clean the table and hinted me she wanted a tip, saying oh she's been working alone all night even thou there's other girls here, it's like working alone. Well train your girls better and maybe you would've continue getting tips from me. 

I honestly don't know if I'm ever going to go back. I guess I'll just have to make sure what the prices are next time, but I would like to go to a resturant or bar and pay what the price is on the menu without having to check the price every 5 minutes. It is that hard to just be honest. Maybe these girls got bad tippers all night and need more $, but either way, they should've gave me a chance instead of charging me more... They just lost 5 people who did want to go back and tipped great.
author: Lynna N.

description: I am a local to this area and this is just what we needed here. Great atmosphere, pretty good apps and a good jukebox. I will be honest TV's could use some HD or better TV quality but other than that, great bar and addition to an area that is getting better and better. Great little outdoor spot. Anita was an awesome bartender so make sure you are there on the nights she is working.
author: Deborah C.

description:
Been here once on friday with a friend and I liked it alot at first, the crowd reminded me of skylarks, and the interior was really nice. We probably weren't in there for more than a half hour and my homie wanted to leave so he kept nagging me the whole time to leave and I kept nagging at him to stay. I was getting real sick and tired of his shit till I went up to the bar which was lined with people. I got behind this guy who looked like he just ordered something and waited so I could order next. 

2 minutes go by....

3....

finally 5, and I ask the dude if he ordered something or if he was just standing there, and he told me all he wanted was a henn and coke. Smh, the whole time I'm thinking this guy had ordred a huge round of drinks or something and all he ordered was a henn and coke, I'm not a bartender but I'm guessing a henn and coke takes really long to make.

2 more minutes pass by, the guy I'm standing behind still didn't get his drink and I see another dude get served up before me. 

Finally another minute passes by and homie walks up to me and says "come on let's leave"..... I take one last look at the bar and the dude who still didn't get his drink, and I take a look at the door.

Cya later bottom's up.
author: Mike A.

description: Bottom's Up, located on Mission just a couple doors down from a Club Tapatio?! Hahah that made me laugh. My bf's friends celebrated their birthdays here, a friend of their's DJ here as well and the music was pretty good. Upon arrival there wasn't a cover, the place is rather small but pretty chill, it seemed like majority of the folks here were friends of friends, so a nice crowd of familiar friendly faces. Drinks are pretty good altho I must say from what I remember my chase was pretty watered down.. no complaints tho, I had a good buzz. They have a seating area against the wall, me and my bf sat for a bit but one of the lady's working the bar I think said we have to have a mini. of 4 people sitting with us.. really? Half the crowd in here were in our party.. all good tho. Good Bar, good music, the only thing that sorta sucked was the parking.. then again it is SF, so it's just something to get use to.
author: karenina c.

description: My new favorite spot. Maybe it's because I'm getting older, I prefer the more relaxing places. So far, everyone I know throws there party here...why? Well for one it's free admission, drinks are at an alright price, it's really chill, and there are tables for everyone to sit. You also have the option to "sweat ya perm out" on the cute little dance floor up front. They usually play really good music, and the owner is such a sweetheart! = ) Oooooh and there's a bonus outside area where you can smoke and sit down and enjoy your drink.
author: Irene N.

description:
Bottoms Up attracts more girls cause it's very nice inside....so you might have to pay an extra dollar for a drink but you get a better environment.  The staff are dressed in lingeire.....got to love it.   Been there only once and it was a a mix of chinese, whites, flipinos and hispanics....just like SF.  Parking was good too. Not sure about walking around the area at night so park close by.
1 - 5 (best)
Ambience: 4 modern glassy interior
Parking ease: 4 on mission
Cleanliness (inc bathrm): 4
Music: 3 hip hop
Crowd: 4 non pretentious mix
author: Jonsee J.

description:
came here on a random night. there were only a couple girls there and a bit of an odd crowd, but again..it was a random night. i loved what i saw and will definately try to check this place out on a friday/saturday night. my buddy was weary about walking in because the name "bottom's up" isnt exactly flattering for 2 straight guys. but we wanted 1 last drink after broken record, so we came here after walking down mission & talking about our girl problems.

we both got a tokyo iced tea and it was strong and actually decently priced. i didn't even finish mine. fabulous decor. cute, asian bartenders. lots of plasma's(and they give you the remote so you can watch what you want). jukebox with all the new hits. clean restroom. comfy seating. seriously, everything you'd want in a lounge. check it out.
author: Andrew T.

description: Gave them one star back... Finally got a call from the manager nearly a week later & got my money back during a late night rendezvous to this place.  I would've given them another star had they apologized for the situation and made me feel comfortable while I sat there waiting for her to find the mistake... Oh well, you win some, lose some.
author: Christine O.

description: This is the owner's 2nd bar.  Shirley's first bar, Would you believe, is on geary and is great as well.  If you frequent this bar alot and get to know her, she'll not only remember your name but also what you like to drink alot.  It's really impressive when you don't stop by the bar in months and she still remembers what you usually order.  Parking may be a bit tricky but it's not too bad.  She always has great bartenders working for her and they are all attentive to all your drinking needs.  They'll have a DJ spin music on the weekends.
author: Allan T.

description:
I've been here twice (both times as a family reunion!) and I loved it.  Pia V.'s my cousin and I have to agree with her review -The fact that there's no cover and dress code is awesome.  They have plenty of bartenders on hand to serve people drinks and they're so nice! It is quite tiny and if you're lucky enough (early enough) to get there as a party is leaving their table, you can have a seat.  The DJ plays decent music, but I'm not really there to dance (it also doesn't help that the dance floor is probably 5 by 6 feet... hahahaha. yippee? hahaha but the place is clean. I believe prices for drinks here aren't outrageous, but not cheap (range 6-9 dollars? I can't remember.  The ladies restroom has 2 stalls only, but there's rarely a line since only so many people fit in the bar/lounge anyway. They have nice outdoor seating for a few people.  Parking can be tough so be prepared to search and/or walk far (good thing there's no cover ladies, so you don't have to wear your heels! hahahaha)

I will definitely be back if ever my cousins wanna part-ay. HELLS YEAH! hahahaha
author: Roxanne K.

description:
WARNING: stay far, far, away from this small, hole in the wall piece of $hiT called "Bottom's Up".  Where do I begin?  Number 1, this place is packed and you can not get from one end to the other.  Plus there is no air conditioning in this place. 2nd, this place just cater's to only a specific ethnic group on various night.  3rd, the thing that got me so worked up about this effen place is the owner, an asian lady she's this little short chinese lady that has medium length hair that is hella permed
and has a raspy voice that sounds kinda like a bitch and she always wear skanky clothes like she dress as if she's 20 when that bitch is actually in her effen late 40's, well that whore bag sent my friend and I away bc we didnt order a 2nd round of drinks.  Remind you, this is a Tuesday night.  As quoted from that skank "okay then if you guys arent going to drink then you should go somewhere else to talk because we're here for business and this area is for people that is going to drink and is for business" you guys cant stay here and talk because you guys arent going to drink. go somewhere else to talk like a coffee shop."  First of all, there were only 3 other customers in there, 2nd of all, skank should be glad that we even order 1 1/2 round of drinks.  If I were you, I would not set foot into this damn spot ever again.  Skanky lady is rude, really rowdy neighborhood, and overall, this place does NOT deserve to be open.  Skank owner is NOT a friendly rodent.  She will shoo you away in a heart beat if you only order 1 round of drinks. WARNING: do not waste your $ and time going to this hell hole.  Spend your $ on beer from the liquor store, or better yet, drive far, far, away from this place.
author: Mimi S.

description:
Horrible place! Absolutely horrible and horrendous! Okay..first of all the bar service was just plain slow and they choose to ignore you. This place was not even that busy, probably less than 30 people and they didn't provide service. One of the bartenders there was texting while pouring drinks. 

ON TOP OF THAT, they refuse to take cards. They have to charge a minimum of 20 dollars on cards, which I'm fine with but they refused to leave my card open. They wanted me to make a purchase now. Either way, they would've gotten their money, either electronically or by paper, but they are so stingy. I had to argue with the bartender based on legal grounds with the contracts that they are obliged to follow when they have a credit card machine. Anyway.....DO NOT GO HERE. 

Seriously, you'll have a much more fun at other bars nearby who treat their customers well. Seriously, in these tough economic times, the least thing you want to do is piss off twenty people, all who are willing to get wasted, but also have cards ready on hand. I was trying to explain that to this bartender who again had the authority to take our money (because she is the owner as well as I found out), but she refused. She preferred cash, which is fine, it's just that our party of twenty five people or so all had cards, and all wanted to leave everything on tab open. Not very smart for a slow night either. So, I don't know what's going on inside that owner's head, but I give that place another three months if they continue to do business like that. 

Seriously, avoid this place at all cost.
author: Alicia A.

description:
bottoms up is like that tv show "Cheers." **where everybody knows your name!**  hahah! i love this place!! and i love shirley. she knows my whole family and all my friends. its my favortie spot!  i'm here almost every other week watching the warriors game or just hanging out and getting drunk.  i guess you're considered a regular  if you're greeted with a hug by shirley everytime you walk in. lol.  

 i love their happy hour special. its from 6-8. you get 2 beers and an appetizer for $10!!!   but the only bad thing is...the kitchen is closed on some days (especially tuesdays! BoOoO! ). but on those days that its closed, you can bring in food like EL FAROLITO which is a couple blocks down...or north beach pizza...or whatevers close by... 

parking is great if you get there early enough! otherwise, you're fucked and you have to find street parking! you can actually park at the bank of america parking lot. dont forget to ask for a parking pass or else your cars gonna get towed! true story! cuz i witnessed my friend's car about to get towed! luckily we got there in time. she forgot to ask for a parking pass! let that be a lesson to everyone! i usually just keep the parking pass in my car so i dont have to ask for another one..

5 stars because:
i love this place
i love shirley 
i love their TV's
i love their happy hour special
i love the B of A parking lot
i love EL Farolito 
and its close to my house!
YAY for bottoms up!
author: B B.

description: Having worked for Shirley at "Would You Believe?" for a few years in the past, I was excited when I found out  2 years ago that she decided to open up a new bar across town. This place is a lot sleeker and updated compared to her original neighborhood bar in the Richmond with glossy floors and a few flat panel TVs. It's a small place and it can definitely be packed like sardines on some nights but it's a decent place to drink especially if you're one of those people who love specialty cocktails--Shirley is always mixing up something new and for the traditionalists, it's not a bad place to order your vodka tonics either.
author: kristin e.

description: I live in the neighborhood and it's as close as it comes to a home bar as it can get.  The music is cool and it has a nice laid-back kind of atmosphere.  The owner is really sweet and I would have given her 5 stars but she made me pay for a drink that I didn't even want to get but did cuz there was a minimum to charge on my credit card, then when it was accidentally spilled, wouldn't replace it.  I wasn't even buzzed yet.  That wasn't cool.
author: Emily L.

description: The atmosphere is pretty good, but everything else is horrible. There's a 20 dollar minimum and you can't open a tab! That's just ridiculous. The bartenders aren't very attentive unless its a slow day. It's either there isn't enough people working or they don't know how to multitask. Never coming to this bar again!
author: Benjamin H.

description:
Recently turned into a regular at Bottoms Up.  The owner is a sweetheart and will always remember a face if you show up more than once.  It's a great place for happy hour on the weekdays.  The food there is excellent.  All the recipes are original and created by the owner herself!  I love this place because it's been open for over a year now but everything is still kept new and CLEAN.

And referring to the ignorant review by Kimmie Q, the crowd was predominantly Filipino that night because there were 7 birthdays being celebrated, half of which happened to be Filipinos.  That's also why it was so packed or as we like to say, crackin.  The bar is not as huge as a club should be because it's a BAR.  There was only one bouncer because it's a BAR but as you could see, it's popular on weekends and that's why they had to hire one.  You don't usually see too many bouncers at bars that are dead.  And it isn't a place to go bar hopping because it's one of the only NICE local bars around in that area.  Obviously it is a different environment from San Jose downtown where plenty of clubs and bars are crowded into a small area.  And there was no fight that broke out and I was there until the very end.  Sorry you were disappointed and couldn't get the real feel of this place but please don't lie in your reviews!  Keep the negativity in SJ and out of SF.
author: Ivy Z.

description: Close to home. Bartenders are nice.  Not too crowded, can bring in a bit of a "ghetto" crowd but it's missions...what do you expect.
author: Tiff W.

description:
love this place. 
bartenders are always friendly.
free wifi
drinks are served dirty.

and can't beat being down the street from my place.

i usually hop between this bar and the owners other bar on geary.
"would you believe?"

i recommend this spot for a quick change from your typical club.
if your smoker, they have outside seating/ which allows smoking and the bartenders come out to serve drinks.

have a DJ friday and saturday. with a small dance floor.

they serve food until about 10 if you come in early enough on certain nights. good food.

i'm a regular and love the fact that everyone knows your name.
author: Marc T.

description: This place has a downtown sort of feel without the overpriced drinks or cover. Drinks are decent- though sometimes getting one takes a while when it gets busy. The weekends get crowded sometimes, but doesn't stay crowded for very long. The owner is pretty friendly and will recognize regulars, but don't get on her bad side.
author: Manny V.

description: Avoid this place over the weekend or if there is some celebration like a birthday. It'll just be too packed since the place is really small. Other than that, it's a great place for the locals that live near by.. *ahem* me *ahem*. They do remember you if you come by often and I love happy hour. Parking can be bad; it depends on the time and day you go. Obviously, over the weekend, it'll be bad but weekdays are ok.
author: Conrad C.

description: I really like the way bottoms up is setup.  The bar is very nice and clean.  They have very cute bartenders and the drinks are resonably priced.  Bottoms up is real close to my home, so I never mine just walking over there, the only thing is that it never really seems like there are a lot of people in there.  I would only go there, if you are planning to relax and not to party.
author: Alexander L.

description: Went here last night. Not bad. The dance floor was a bit too small thus making it very hard for me to get up off my ass. The drinks were well made. I was a bit puzzled by their $20 minimum with no option to keep a tab open? The girl to guy ratio sucked. Not really my crowd. The climax of my night had to be the $6.50 Steak and Shrimp Burrito I bought across the street from the laundry mat. Can someone please give me the name of it...I got to give that place 5 STARS!
author: J Q.

description: i try and come here on a regular basis only cause my friends go here. to me the drinks here are like every other bar. fairly priced not bad. i like the atmosphere its trendy yet a comfortable place to hang out for college students. i like the service here a lot since i know the owner shirly through repeated visits so she usually treats me pretty well. i think my favorite part is the lounge area outside the front. . you can hang out and smoke and be as loud as you want nobody really trips. unless you get outta hand.
author: Nicholas Y.

description: It's a pretty chill atmosphere. THe ladies behind the counter are always friendly and accomodating. The manager is extremely friendly and doesn't shy away from greeting everyone who's there. Each time I go there, I leave with a smile - so that should say more than enough about the place.
author: Thea G.

description:
sausage fest - like stumbling into a castro bar in excelsior

other than that, whats with the nickel and diming with the drinks?  6.50?  like anybody ever keeps the .50 in change.
author: Herb N.

description: I went to this place a few times because one of my old friends lives around here and recommended it. The place is pretty nice and fairly new. The prices are decent and the service is good. It can get pretty packed though on the weekends. I haven't tried the food nor have I seen/heard the DJ that they now have. All in all, it's a decent place to go to and lounge but there are much better places out there.
author: Diane M.

description:
very very cute decor inside... something so unexpected judging from the neighborhood.  

this is a bar... but they serve like dinner here too.  you can order like pork chops, chicken wings, thai style fried rice, sushi.... very nice.  

decent quality, plated nicely, kinda pricey...

drinks are a good size though.
author: Tina L.

description: So I went here with my friend Paolo from Mama's Cafe and was impressed with the decore. The ambiance is still rough around the edges but with time, that will change. I enjoyed myself except for the jukebox at times was REAL loud. The bartenders are quite cute and the drinks are pretty good....this is a great spot to stop by and chill with friends and mingle with the locals. If you are genuine...the service should be a pleasant experience.
author: Dennes H.

description: everyones talkin bout the neighborhood?!?!  it aint that bad. c'mon!  anyways, this spot is good to go...been there since they opened up.  sport bikes reign this bar, including mine, and so do scooters haha...shirley is doin a fine job runnin her bar and her other one in the aves...that place runs thru bartenders like a mug though...i dig that internet jukebox, drinks, and how u can hop off the stretch (14 mission) right in front...red carpet haha...and u can wash your clothes and kill time next door at bottoms, AKA "a$$ up" which is what we call it...go here, have a drink,be happy, go home...peace
author: Kawika C.

description: I happened to go for a cousins birthday, there was a line...good sign if your the owner(BUSINESS) not so much if your a patron (THIRSTY). This place was SUPER packed, getting to the bar was a mission and getting service was unimaginable, ridiculous, not good. The drinks were decently priced, the shots were a bit uneven, hit and miss. Not too big into going out of my way....
author: Joe J.

description: It's a very nice place. Everything I ever wanted in a bar. The list goes on. Roomy, nice sound system, clean, cute bartenders, a great selection of beverages, and nice seating arrangement. One of the nicest drinking facilities I've ever been to. The walk to the men's room is quite a journey. It gives me a lot of time to collect my thoughts. However, I don't plan to go back because I personally don't like  the location. Yeah, location is the make it or break it for me.
author: Butch M.

description: Alright, I have to say this bar will not win the best in the city award, but it is the nicest looking bar in the Excelsior. I love their Lychee mojitos and their wet pussy drinks. Awsome!!!!! I have spent many nights howling at the moon in this bar. Drinks can be pricy, so if you don't want to go to Lucitas or Pist off Pete's and are looking for something with a little more atmosphere come into Bottom's Up!  Cheers guys!
author: Eli R.

description: Nice bar, looks clean, friendly bartenders, and pretty comfortable.  Service can get a little slow, but overall, good environment.
author: OLGA M.

description: This bar is pretty darn impressive. Parking can get crazy around here depending on what night you go, but no worries! The bouncer or bartenders can hook you up with a parking permit for the B of A just down the street. Of course the lot there isn't ginormous, so it would be wise to get one while spaces are still available. The price for drinks here is reasonable. My girl and I each had 2 Jaeger bombs, totaling $28. Most bars I go to don't really give customer service outside of the actual bar itself. But being that it wasn't too hectic of a night, the bartenders and the owner herself checked up on us and cleaned up after us consistently. Plus side for the fellas, the bartenders here are all female. The DJ was enjoying himself during his set and played some pretty bumpin' music. Not only that, he was eating a bowl of noodles at the same time. Who does that?!  I wouldn't say this would be the place to go all out on the floor since 1) it's a bar and 2) being that it is one, don't expect the supposed "dance area" to be huge, if even there at all. My night ended with me following my nose to the hot dog vendor down the street. If you haven't tried a bacon wrapped hot dog after downing a few at a bar, you're seriously missing out.
author: Rhia R.

description: i stopped by here on a saturday night and this place was crackin'!  i loved the music that the dj was playing.. me and my friends were fobbin' it up by playing dices.. only the best drinking game there is! haha.. especially if u change the dice when ur friends are off chatting on their cell phones =)
author: JUDY L.

description: I gave this club 3 out of 5 stars.  There are a few reasons.  But let me start with the good things about this place.  First off, the servers/bartenders are absolutely cute, although not as nice as I thought they'd be.  The drink menu is great, lots of choices, and the long island I ordered was worth the $7.  Music was jukebox generated, but hip hop played all night.  The place was clean and so was the restroom.  There wasn't a lot of people, so no real waiting for anything.  What I didn't like, was the fact that you can't keep a tab, if you use credit there's a $20 minimum, and they don't have complimentary water.  It took a while for the place to fill up, but I have to say, the eye candy was not too bad.  I love you bay area girls.  All in all, i'd come here every so often...  3.5 stars.
author: RayRay E.

description: This is a good spot to go to if you just want to chill or hang out. The bartenders are friendly and cute. It has a nice atmosphere, which is rather unexpected considering it's location. There's always music on, sometimes a DJ. And on certain nights, it can get really packed with a bunch of people who frequent the bar. Overall, it's a cool spot.
author: Eina L.

description: this place is really funny. the interior cracks me up, esp. considering where its at.
author: christopher a.

description: `constantly kept shoo-ing away fruitflies attracted to my orange, that was hanging off my glass of blue moon. real annoying.
author: Sheila S.

description: i wouldn't really hang out here all the time but it's a kool spot to do some early week drinkin.  sun-tues not to crowded just how i like it. flat screen tvs, decent priced drinks ($5 stoli) the bartenders seem inexperienced but i don't think they were hired for their skills but they are very friendly and pour a stiff drink. i hear they have djs and it gets pretty busy on weekends but i will pass on that.
author: Ausewaldoe J.
